xDqGPRY2nTRGWvuDH85mgA.review_text: Neighborhood dive bar. Great happy hour promotion involving chips or something like that. I have trouble exactly remembering what the promotion is because of said promotion. All I remember is FEEL FREE TO TIP ON THE CHIP. (bartenders love me)  Sports happen. Wii bowling on Tuesday nights. Young happy bartenders raising families. Working class bar vibe. Pictures of longshoremen striking on the walls. As if anyone in this neighborhood made less than $90k a year these days. Still, it's a good place for me to watch people my age act embarassing the instant anything by Journey comes on the juke box.

9Dj1F91KRmO9ARrKmvkWjQ.review_text: Where else can you come in for a drink, get an excellent recommendation for dinner, go to eat dinner, and return, with a tiny chip, for a free drink?  I loved this place!! My hubby and I wandered in after a day of touristy sight seeing. The restaurant we had planned to go to was closed, so we stopped in for a beer and to figure out where to go. Michael, the bartender, was wonderful!!! He suggested a local restaurant. So, we went to eat and returned for our second happy hour beer. Cool to offer the special until 9 pm, even after happy hour has ended. Michael introduced us to Furnet, which is a lacquer sort of like Jager. So yummy!! Michael was so cool; we wanted to be regulars. Sadly, we had to return to Phoenix. He made us feel at home and comfortable in a "foreign"city.

tviRa0oeyDx0-LmKwsHJnw.review_text: definitely a chill spot, good tunes in the juke box, a mixture of different types of friendlies minus the hipsters, good service... can you really ask for much more.

89XdXGptcUPmrNRLF71Pzw.review_text: This is by far one of my favorite Bars in San Francisco.  You can't beat the happy hour here.  2 for 1 beers everyday from 4-8pm.  Great selection of beers on tap, bar tenders kick ass, you can always find a good game of pool here too.  My kind of bar.

wY2OPBVOOJ9kvjuqXBamtA.review_text: Don't roll into this place if you wanted to be treated like a princess or you have a #basic attitude. This place is a chill dive bar with a great beer selection and upgraded TV's (the best TV situation in north beach). The Happy Hour is unbeatable (2 for 1 draught beers 4-8pm They play the sound for big sports events, and allow you to bring in your own food. Limited seating, the bar does get crowded at times (especially on thursday/fridays after work).

x2-TP8fd4G0OqkgDyKt3IA.review_text: A friend of mine was DJing at Monroe Saturday night and we wanted to bar hop before we got there so we ended up at Columbus Cafe. My friends love this spot and I totally get why -- it has a great vibe, cheap drinks, solid tap selection, music, pool tables, and a chill crowd. We ended up staying here for more than a few drinks and had a great time. There are some screens too, looks like it would be a fun place to catch a game.

4Po_4vgdBFk2GPeKfJqVww.review_text: Ummmm...ok, so the name is a little weird:  it's not on Columbus...and it's not a cafe.  What is it?  Only one of the best bars in the city!  I love this place.  Just divey enough not be a lounge.  Just clean enough not to be a dive.  The happy hour is awesome...oh the love of the poker chip and the free beer it represents.  Great beers on tap, by the way.  Bartenders?  Friendly and fast...no better combination.  And to top it all off, I came back after dinner for another beer, it was PACKED, and some guy let us have his stools.  Really?  Who does that?  In North Beach?  Nice.  Very nice.  Meet you there for happy hour?  That little stretch of Green St is adorable...

M-Omxs825UaLyqud8g4eBA.review_text: I love the tattooed bartender with the bleached hair! She is so cute and friendly. Definitely the perfect bartender.  The place is alright. Fun to drop by during a night in the city. Busy even on a Tuesday.   :)

HkKQnZd8jT8WtlJKH0X77w.review_text: I have been here after SEVERAL dinners/evenings out.  Meaning, i never START here.... but i always have the idea to go later.  i don't even know what that means.  hm.  anyhoo, it's a fun friendly bar with A LOT of regulars and well, booze.

N0F5oCQeCfowPCEtuxiDsA.review_text: The last two times I've been there, the male bartender (the one working during the day on Sunday, June 29) has been unbelievably rude. It's alarming that he still works there.  If you want to be treated like a valued customer (or even a human being), skip this place.

hq1X6tIBTNQufilIhrZK7g.review_text: I like this place a lot.  You really can't beat the 2 for 1 happy hour (with the creative poker chips).  Not a huge draft selection, but it's more than good enough for me.  The bartenders are friendly, and the patrons are in there for a good time and a friendly chat.  For the most part, it's a dudes bar - but it's not so meathead-ish that they all want to watch Entourage after a few chugs.  Single girls or groups of girls don't really come here for some reason.  CC is also a bit of a dive - dingy, dark, damp.  But all in all, it's really easy to have a good time.

ygh1FAM5zmfWFeKsV6wJRg.review_text: If you can rile a crowd and have a packed bar by 2:30pm on a sunny Saturday afternoon, you're doing something right.  Bonus points for dealing with all of us ridiculous St. Patty's Day bar crawlers.

SeG2NWwKVAZmRoQDzL-bNA.review_text: This is a terrific happy hour, great beer selection,  2 for 1 till 8pm. I paid ten bucks for 4 beers. Best happy hour in SF as far as I'm concerned. Great old time character bar, gotta love the pictures of Rocky Marciano on the wall. I'll return.

WI9UJah3bVB258wzEIh34A.review_text: The last fuzzy thing I remember from my evening at the Columbus Cafe was Starla grabbing me by the elbow and ushering me into a cab with her to get me to stop making out with someone...  it must have been a good night.  Great little North Beach bar, drinks are reasonable and the joint is cozy.

nYufXwZH9ooB_zjNJf8Xlg.review_text: My spot in SF. There are many like it, but this one is mine. The beautiful and charismatic Karlee D has installed many hangovers upon me and got the B into Bubbies pickles and told us about Broken Record, a place we all like. We have also met a myriad of madcap individuals here including a Chilean miner and a House. Can't get no cooler than that..

EypheQVNvJdQIN5Y9Tr98A.review_text: We came here for New Year's Eve and the place was perfect for what we were looking for.  Cute girls, cheap drinks, friendly people, great music selection...can't really beat that.  The only reason I am subtracting 1 star was for the fact that there were 3 bar fights in the span of an hour...although I doubt that is a regular occurance, that is just out of hand.  Maybe it is just because I am from SD and have seen about 1 bar fight in the 3 years since I turned 21 down there (most people are pretty chill) but I was pretty shocked.  Then again, it was New Year's and all of the people looked like they were 3 sheets at the time.

Q65so6iZytMNO6mdMckifQ.review_text: this place is pretty great. anywhere with 1.50 draft beers cant be beat. i've only been here once, but i would definitely go back. cheap beers and board games makes for a very fun time.

G6C5MhtajK2srA5pjeg2ww.review_text: Looks like a total dive from the outside.  Well, okay, so it definitely isn't "fancy" but no Marina folks!!!!  Two stars.  This place has happy hour and fun tokens.  What more could a girl want, it's great for groups, and has TVs for watching UCLA kick Cal and USC's ass?  :o)

yXqD9UU_RvU4jfP1UmKW9Q.review_text: Best happy hour in town, indeed.  Not a bad place to hang out.  Nice bartender.

lM9ZDLy3Uz4BOPmyB6euWA.review_text: I just moved to the city and was going to try to find a good local, when low and behold the most amazing bar fell into my lap!  Really nice staff, nice people, good happy hour.  Also sometimes there is dancing but its not meant for that purpose, people just like to dance because this place makes everyone so happy!

79X-pfwVx-URimuRU21ITA.review_text: Beer selection good, check. Great happy hour deal, check. Friendly crowd, check.  I liked this place. Can get really crowded at times but overall has a good atmosphere. Fun for a group of people, or just to lay low and get a drink and play some pool...  or even some tunes to drunkenly sing to on the jukebox.

VAI4LygxcbgHctXSS63kbg.review_text: Hanging out in my friends SF apartment and I found out that we are both fans of this place. Really. I live in AZ, what are the chances that out of all the freaking bars in SF, we are both fans of this hole in the wall? Its like.. its meant to be!  I don't have much to follow up. Columbus Cafe still rocks even though it literally is a tiny little bar. As I waited to use the 1-stall bathroom I watched and talked to the dudes playing pool. I hear the door unlock and turn around to get ready to enter the bathroom, where I see a girl coming out.... followed by a guy with the biggest smile on his face.  -_-  I look at him and say "what.the.fuck". "Oh its not what you think" Sure its not, loverboy. Now get the hell out of my way and let me pee. I don't want to even begin to think where you left all your love stains. Ew.

RxcIU7cJGxFtMgx84HaHRA.review_text: 2 for 1 pints during happy hours! :D When you get your first drink, you're given a token chip for your second drink. For people like me, this is great because you don't necessarily have to have both your drinks at the same time. From my understanding, you can come back any time and use your chip on your second drink.   Friendly staff, friendly crowd & cheap drinks. & There's a photobooth and pool table in the back as well. I will definitely be back with friends :D

zpswu_OyqtF4ib1ydsCR3Q.review_text: Upstairs was fun but a little crowded and it was kinda hard to get a drink.  Downstairs smelled like vomit and it the lights hurt my brain...shockingly easy to get a drink.

mXPpMRWMYXCZUqDPD4Fycw.review_text: Happy hour spots in SF are a dime a dozen. Even with this handy Yelp app, you can always try a new one, almost daily. As we made our rounds around North Beach, we decided to give Columbus a go.   The drink specials during HH can't be beat. The draft beers and between $3-4 and include a token for a free beer after. I felt like I was in Vegas with all the chips I collected by the end of the night.   Great spot for large groups and it's located so close to an amazing drunk pizza spot just 3 doors up the street.

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: best happy hour ever!!  buy one beer and you get a token for a 2nd beer, and you can use that token even after happy hour.  you can't beat that deal!  great beer selection too!

nFPpHjvJgcE7M66MMrbs8g.review_text: This is just about my favorite place in the city.  2 for 1 happy hour beers (you can save the free beer chip and redeem at a later date). bartenders that are as nice as they are adorable. and THREE DOLLAR FERNETS!!! all day, every day.  jukebox is good, with the feature to download music, but it's always better when the bartenders have their ipods playing.  much M.I.A., punk rock, and reggae.  I'm still holding out hope that they will rent out the downstairs as a studio, so i can just live here.

8d6Mdzh_GWk9gZTqrsGJrw.review_text: A cool bar in North Beach!   Went here for a friends birthday, good amount of bar stools and tables for seating, cool movies on the TV's, bartenders are nice, not a bad place to be! We asked the bar tender to make us all a shot and she whipped up an electric blue sort of drink that was smooth going down!   Great happy hour specials which is always a plus in my book, and the window by the door makes it easy to people watch and chat with the people outside smoking (if you have friends that smoke!) Seems to bring back regulars and I can see why!   Cheers!

tEStbT_jIZzmGrkBwLx-kw.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
tEStbT_jIZzmGrkBwLx-kw.review_text: This is my local watering hole and I love it. The 2-for-1 happy hour on a solid selection of beers is just awesome!   I like all the bartenders and have developed a nice coalition of regulars to hang out with on any given night of the week. The place has a punk-rock vibe until somebody gets on the jukebox. Attracts a nice mix of people.

TFpNMh-yRcPiWcFMuIY2bg.review_text: 2 for 1 draft beers 7 days a week?!? What's not to love??? Great location and cool people? I will defenitely be back!

1Yp3zswZk9jR5wfqJWVFhA.review_text: the 2-for-1 happy hours are just plain fabulous.  i became a regular here a while ago but every time i turn up the old bartenders, bouncers and regulars remember me.  they are always friendly and willing to get me drunkety-drunk-drunk.  the crowd can be 50-50. some nights it's just a sausage fest, other times it's like you're surrounded by a high school graduation class but thus is the gamble for kicking in north beach.  But on those nights when the crowd is just perfect, it makes me wish last call didn't exist.

J7Ko9iOG1Hg74PCtP9mLxw.review_text: Cool bar wasn't too packed on a saturday night.  $15 minimum for credit card tab.  Just happy they actually took credit cards since a lot of the bars down here only take cash.     Will update the review if I come back for more than a few drinks.

aM3T4jeHY_fswn6xQ41rtw.review_text: Great happy hour spot, 2 for 1 drinks.   Rolled in here because it looked like a cool spot, and I was pretty happy with the decision. There was a very lively happy hour crowd on a Friday evening. They played good music and had a few games on TV. Not too much to hate here.

-ty5eC5N6uWkEAt-j-E6SQ.review_text: Home of the 2 for 1 beers. Is there really much else that needs to be said for this bar? I came here straight from work (Potrero Hill dude) one day and was desperately needing a drink. I suddenly realized that I actually needed two drinks. How the heck was I gonna remedy this need for two drinks...at the same time?! Two drinks For the Price of One!! Are you kidding me? Incredible...and you're telling me that if my mom calls me and says, "Mike, you need to come home and clean up the dog poop from the back yard right now mister!" that I can keep my chip for the next time? Now you guys must be pulling my leg. Wait....am I still in N. Beach? Maybe I took a wrong turn and ended up in the Sunset or something. Nope - there's 4 guys playing pool and wearing striped, untucked button down shirts over there, so I know that I'm in N. Beach (I keed, I keed.) Anyway, this place gets 4 stars outta me - also because the bartender tried to down sell me into a PBR cause I was wearing an Olympia shirt.

1qXTfHO55GmMpVhKKfZA8Q.review_text: When I first drank Fernet I was in this dive bar with a bunch of ad people. I thought it was the most disgusting thing I ever ingested and vowed never to have it again.  The second time I had it was on Forbes Island. I then discovered its curious ability to cause and cure motion sickness, at the same time.  Third time was at Love Fest in front of the Listed float. At this point I was drinking it straight out of the bottle.  The fourth time, however, was at Columbus Cafe. After 6 or 7 shots, you begin to see things. Matt M says he saw a unicorn, but I saw penguins. Four of them. They came into the bar single file, shot a round of pool, and left out the back.   To this day, I don't know where those peculiar web footed transients were headed, but I hope they found their way.

L2X-a5KWRPhCp62rqBroSQ.review_text: Probablly the best bar in North Beach. Great draft beer selection, even though I always seem to drink the same kind. $3 shots of Fernet. YUM YUM,  The Happy hour has 2 for 1 drinks! A bunch of restaurants everywhere. NEED I SAY MORE?

W82cYXhC2_Rm1IFpGGW8Pg.review_text: Let me preface with - we love this place. And Karlee is a sweetheart...  We were there a few months ago, normal Saturday night, super busy, which we expected. So I go up to the bar and order a scotch and 7up, and a vodka soda. Somehow the bartender (which was the bar back at the time) gave us a vodka 7up and a scotch and soda. Honest mistake, so I turn around (had a sip of each) and said, hey pal, so sorry to do this but you switched the two. He YELLS back, Nope, Wrong. So, calmly, and knowing that neither of us had ordered anything above well, I lean over and say, Maybe we misheard each other, but really, this isn't drinkable. He rolled his eyes at me and walked away. Refused to serve me again...  Hopefully this guy isn't working there any longer.  On happier notes, the drinks are way cheap, the music is always bumping, and you can usually get a spot at the pool table or a seat at the tall cocktail tables. I'll be back, and be sure to order from Karlee...

uXSVu2ldBncOGMcvI9SW2Q.review_text: I hate Fernet- hate it with a fiery passion- and the only place I've had it is here- so it says something that this place still gets 4 stars from me. Cheap drinks, two for one happy hour, fabulously nice bartenders, a great jukebox, and the ability to order in pizza. The only problem with the place (and its not really a problem, just an observation) is that the floors get so sticky and grimy at the end of the night that you can see dirt and grime on the bottom of your pants when you leave. But still, awesome place. And now, they sell the cutest t-shirts now, adorably slim-cut for girls.

2gP8s5dOJmwVKVm0GNMU0w.review_text: really cool bar. great music and the bartenders are awesome. good vibe all around.

6ATfXxQLQuRAQ30-nLI6Yg.review_text: I think every single review starts with this, but YES, they definately have 2 for 1 beers at happy hour.  You get a poker chip with the first one, and you can use it for a freebie.  Kinda nice that you can save it for another day.  That being said, I'm not a huge fan of the place.  It's chill for a dive bar, but it's crowded quite a bit and I can't really figure out why.  The bartenders absolutely ROCK so I'll give a star to each one I know....   No cover, cheap drinks, and almost always a sausage fest, come here when you want to get shitty drunk with a friend or two and don't care who you meet.

cY2O_YfM_e45jkiYl4U3Sg.review_text: The bartender on Sunday afternoons is not a very nice guy. It made the experience here a much less enjoyable one, I was afraid to go up to the bar and order something else...scared he'd yell at me or say something snarky.  Besides that...It's very divey, not many tables, but a good spot to get away from the usual go-to's.

pKYOy6OsyQBRv188IKbPHQ.review_text: Columbus Cafe is fine.  They have 2 for 1 beers before 8 and I often start birthday bar crawls there.  The crowd is pretty heavily male and it can feel a little bit like Marina East, but there's nothing really wrong with that.

DjXEUA6ltpOCgzy3Q8D_xg.review_text: I normally like a little yuppier place with yuppish people but I have seen the light. Take away the facts, that I live across the street from this place and that my awesome roommate works here, but this is good times. Always a good time with good drinks to be had and you can even meet some good people, possibly a few good entertaining drunks too. If you're in North Beach and you want a chill time, come on down to the Columbus Cafe, you won't be disappointed.

u9RU-VYTrsY9c9yfTsgNww.review_text: Best espresso I have had in San Francisco yet! This gives me hope (please let's not mention the Greco incident). The barista is an absolute artist. Didn't seem at all like a bar to me (though I was there for lunch). The food was good, but it's hard to concentrate on eating, with an oustanding specimen of a white mocha demanding all of your sensory inputs.

FI0dcCAuFmW0lutdKO2UwA.review_text: Bartenders here have big tudes but otherwise it's an ok place.  That is, cool when the loud and annoying 20's somethings aren't acting like absolute retards down in the clicky little corner of the bar.  Seems like a lot of young 'I've got the world by the balls" class A young morons like this place.  Happy hour on the weekend rocks though!   Not a bad place to watch a game.

B33KEetBrqpnJbQZetY3sQ.review_text: It all started to go wrong when I ordered two $3 shots of fernet, and then did both of them within five minutes of each other.     Why?   Why?  Why?  Answer:  So I could end up with Jaime's hat.

jyZ1RHNDbzBvEzxjKEaPBw.review_text: Nothing too special about this place, I just like coming here with my buddies.  Good place to drink, shoot pool and listen to the jukebox that boasts an impressive selection.  Oh yeah, 2 for 1 happy hour is obviously a good thing.

k3WjpSYRz0l7NUHSuc_Ybg.review_text: Went here on Halloween as it is nearby work. I couldn't believe the two for one pints until 9pm! It was awesome. I think I got drunk for like 15 bucks and it was a nice Belgium beer!  Definitely coming back.

4pzr6KuS85859EICMI7MDw.review_text: Columbus Cafe is one of my favorite no-frills bars in North Beach. It doesn't have an overly cheesy theme or gimmick, there isn't a cover during special days like a lot of their neighbors (St. Patrick's Day), the drinks aren't obscenely expensive, and the bartenders actually give a damn and pay attention to your order and fill it quickly.  I love starting my night and ending my night here, because it's conveniently in the middle of North Beach, and just a few doors down from Golden Boy Pizza.   I was most recently here on St. Patrick's day when my friends and I didn't exactly want to pay a silly cover charge to go into a crowded bar or corral in the streets. We had no problem getting in and no problem getting drinks. I've also been her countless times before on the weekend, before dates at local restaurants or shows at Beach Blanket Babylon or... the Hustler Club.  It's not the biggest bar, nor is it the best bar, but it's definitely a great bar that I frequent almost every time I come to the neighborhood.

PFv_v-hEebIktD7WLrltLw.review_text: I generally don't make it over to North Beach, but a friend was visiting from out of town and staying in Fisherman's Wharf (uuugh), so we found this little watering hole.  Once we were inside, I thought this place was pretty great.  (The doorman was a total dork.) The people were friendly and the bartender was chatty.  I usually hate when bars have TVs showing sports, but while we were sitting there my friend says "The only sport I like showing in a bar is big wave surfing."  I thought that was a great sentiment and as we sat milling it over, basketball ended and (no joke) a big wave surfing competition started.  Creeeepy.

fD57AENiuVILooHbpWfcCw.review_text: Awesome bar.   The buy a pint get one free deal is excellent. Enough said.

-qDiotF8Qd0ThdLNEpg9Aw.review_text: Why you should come here:  1) 2-for-1 beers on weekday happy hours  2) Football on plasma screens  3) Great beer on tap (I for one would do terrible things for a Rogue Ale Honey Brown Nectar)  4) Golden Boy pizza next door, mmmmmm

PlRQBvaBCEkZeetp9QUNXg.review_text: I used to like this place a lot a couple years ago. Jukebox, pool, rock and roll. Now it's bro-town. The bartenders are nice, but the crowd here is always full of tools. I wonder if they share a crowd with Northstar.  I went by the other night (dead sober) to pop in and see if a friend was shooting pool inside. There was no door guy in sight. I walked in and felt someone GRAB ME BY MY WRIST and pulled me back, THEN asked for my id. I was really confused about where he came from, and had he not said "I need your id" when he did I would have slapped the living hell out of him.  I'm so over you, Columbus Cafe.

IxKjgqLAG6teY_pqGnh9ZQ.review_text: Columbus Cafe use to be my second home.  I can be found here at least once a week sippin' on a pint glass of beer or taking a shot of Fernet when I first moved to North Beach!    Update: 12/11/2007 A casual date with an awesome guy named Nick on a Tuesday night.  We had 3 beers each.  Karlee, the coolest bartender, and I also had a shot of Jameson.  Yum :-)!    Update: 7/1/2007 Meet up with Patrick M. at Washington Square Park and headed over to Columbus Cafe.  Good times, great company, interesting conversation, 5 beers and a shot of fernet each -- perfect way to get to know someone better ;-)!  11/28/2007: Wednesday Night The roomie and I decided to spend a weeknight at Columbus because of Thanksgiving the next day... no WORK!  As we sat having some great conversations, random guys started approaching towards us.  The guys were decent, but not good enough to pursue.  Update: 3/25/2007 Sunday night drinking with a fun, cool guy.  CHARTREUSE, FERNET, and TUACA shots.  Then two pint glasses of Hoegaarden on tap made Miss C very, very happy ;-)!  ********_________________**********  It's been a stressful week because of moving, but I finally had some time last night to relax.  After watching LOST, Randy (Guy #1) and I took a stroll down North Beach to Columbus Cafe. The bar wasn't too crowded, just a few people here and there and a group playing pool -- a very chill atmosphere.  We sat at the bar.  He got a pint of Stella Artois and an Amstel Light for me.  We talked, kissed, as we sipped our beers while watching "Hooters Beauty Pageant" on TV.    It was a perfect night: "At Last" by Etta James was playing from the digital jukebox, a handsome man by my side who occasionally whispered sweet nothings into my ear, 26 microbrews on tap, $3 fernet shots and Smiroff Ice, friendly bartenders (they are awesome), clean bathroom, and happy hour everyday from 4p-8p with 2 for 1 specials (2 beers for the price of 1).  Beer makes me happy.  Beer with a man who is a great kisser is even better ;-)!   I predict that I will be a regular here at Columbus Cafe because it's a few blocks away from my apartment.  Will probably be here at least once a week.  It's a great place to hang out with friends afterwork or with a date for a late night drink or two.  Try the Pyramid Apricot Pale Ale -- it's yummy!  Total Beer Count at the end of the night:            Celeste: 3 Amstel Light           Randy: 4 Stella Artois  PBR me, ASAP!

bSY04kIrbB3J9cyNBiKfcQ.review_text: Been here a few times when I am out in the city.  It's a cool place to get some drinks in before hitting the bigger bars/clubs in the area.  Drinks are reasonably priced but service is a little slower.  Each time I've been here, there was only one bartender but I still got my drink.  I'd come back for a visit next time I'm in the Northbeach area.

GVeOyQJ1uTKvxNF-9d6eFQ.review_text: After a long day at work this is my go to place. $2 fernets and a huge selection of 2 for 1 beers till 8. This place is a bar, nothing more nothing less. Bartenders are always cool i.e. karlee, zoe, danielle. If you want a laid back place to get a beer with no pretense this is the place.

xO1fXjGulknU5nWbKghKMQ.review_text: 2 for 1 happy hour = good  However:  I'm sick of walking to work and sidestepping 6 piles of puke from CC casualties.  Early weeknights = good Thurs - Sun nights = oh hell no.

8Kg5_KZ2rdvjJclbqgrBiA.review_text: We had a great time in here with Angelita. Nice bar w good drinks and cold beer.  What else would you need to know?

tRoHSuw45Gex_Eeu1g3xRg.review_text: Great local bar. Everything was awesome here. Great beers, customers, and staff...except for one. The bartender named Evan was really rude, condescending towards me, and borderline offensive. He never gave me my free beer (BOGO) and accused me of lying when I asked about it. This guy could really ruin a good thing. I asked the locals and apparently, he is rude to just about everyone.   Overall, ill go here when I'm in SAN FRAN.

_SVAW_bwFx3G2tDqmsmOBw.review_text: Sometimes you travel around North Beach in disgust.  You're surrounded by overpriced restaurants, you get stopped by tourists for an Italian restaurant recommendation and finding a parking spot is atrocious.  But then you happen upon an awesome spot like Columbus Cafe and you regain trust in the neighborhood.  It's just off of Columbus on Green, away from all the terrible crowds and other tourists too scared to veer off the main street.  They have a slightly above average selection of beer with Speakeasy and Dechutes to keep some of the more beer savvy happy.  They had non-Sharks hockey on the tube along with other sports (I call a Bay Area bar legit if they're willing to show more than just Sharks' hockey).  The place is low lit and has the perfect amount of ambiance (and tiny bathroom) to make you feel like you're at home in San Francisco.  Adding it all up, I probably could've been here for at least a few hours if I didn't have to be somewhere else.  I doubt it's going down as one of my "favorite" bars just yet but Columbus Cafe is definitely worth a stop if you're drinking and in the 'hood.

_yS8hvlOf9B48h_qgyd0CQ.review_text: After about 20 minutes in this cafe/bar, I was pretty impressed.  The draught beer choice was good, the service was friendly, the location was great and the ambiance is entertaining.   Columbus Cafe has a lot to offer, whether you're looking for a snack, happy hour special or just a place to surf the internet on their computers.   Another cool aspect: the ceilings in this place are HIGH, which allowed the decorators to get creative and give CC an even more amazing feel.   Go there immediately and be merry!

WNQNNhAVbtX4Ki-Xn1EfCQ.review_text: I guess I was hitting on the bartenders lady, because he kicked me out. Must be nice to have faux power bitch. Have fun bartending at a jenky ass spot.

xW7Umtxl_-eKnVQmm3wLbA.review_text: Don't be fooled by the name of the place, it's not a cafe, but rather a place to have good drinks, beer and watch sports!   I've been here a couple times while waiting for a table for dinner at a nearby restaurant. It's always super packed on Friday or Saturday nights, especially when there's a Giants game on (or any other Bay Area sport!) Both times I've been here, I've had a good time drinking and hanging out with friends. It's a nice little spot to hang out if you have nothing to do and you're around the area.   The drinks aren't expensive, but the bar can be packed at times, so be prepared to wait a little, mainly because there's usually only one bartender. There's also a pool table inside, so you can hit some balls into holes if that interests you at all.

VQG45LKVq2H_Owa7hnUV-w.review_text: I've only sailed in here once, but it's a fun dive bar in North Beach with a lot of decent beer on tap and they're likely to be showing "the game du jour."     There probably isn't a better bar in San Francisco to celebrate a guy with bad navigation skills who named the people already living there after the land he thought he was in and then traded corn for infectious diseases.  Happy Columbus Day!!

vTugBdYg34rX4KvGpzBrNA.review_text: A group of us went here after dancing and of course I was WAY over dressed. I didn't get too many weird looks which is always good! There was fun music playing and some people were all out dancing in the small space. I shook my butt a little bit, but nothing too extreme. The bartenders were really nice and fast, I never had to wait more than a minute to get a drink.  I was also told that there is a cool downstairs area for private parties which sounds pretty cool too. This is just a really chill, fun bar to go to!

G8RpowvR9LodKj4_BCPMaQ.review_text: I remember coming here! I do! I swear to it! I have a happy-hour drink token to prove it.  That's what I like about Columbus-- two for one beer at happy hour.  At any other time... I don't think I'd give Columbus four stars.  Just, please, for goodness sake, stay away from the fernet, especially on an empty stomach. It may taste alright at first, but it's got a horrid aftertaste, and will fuck your shit up. Thankfully I had arrived in the company of a beautiful woman who was more than happy to short-circuit that trainwreck and get the heck out.

9VXqxCMuYybCpk-Wuf3Nvw.review_text: Best dive in town in my opinion..and right next to the best pizza and Italian place. My boyfriend often works in SF and stays in North Beach so we can just crawl back to our room if we need to, ha! Lots of good people watching too..mostly locals who are regulars like the Chinese Johnny Depp and Def Leppard Mullet Man. We love the jukebox and playing pool there..everyone is usually happy.

8fgiuFMuN5yfoALzts-K7w.review_text: A cool bar, I find myself hanging out at this place somewhat regularly.  Pool table in the back and a few TVs to watch a game on.  Good prices for drinks.  They even play some pretty good rock music on the speakers.  Only problem is, as with most bars in San Francisco (and North Beach especially, it seems) the douchebag clientle can sometimes make an appearance.    Best time to go to this bar is on weekdays so you can avoid the crowds and get in on the drink specials.

PvMpZhBQ03nfa19yxMZo9Q.review_text: best bar i found while visiting the bay area...amazing happy hour! its always crowded but the bartenders are super nice and quick at getting you drinks

XP32BMm5JmcogLMTf-JUGg.review_text: I love their happy hour special. To top that...I once got a beer and grey goose and sprite for $13. How awesome of a price is that!

zC42MRNl9NLKzbtYzAG24g.review_text: 2 for 1 happy hour with reusable poker chips = yippee skippee.  I went here on a random wednesday afternoon and ended up touring the world via beer.  They have enough beers on tap to satisfy any thirst you might have.  Had a lot of fun hanging out with everyone inside.   Joseph M's review below says it all.  Check it out.

B_aCdiBTkte92sOGlmLWlw.review_text: $2 FERNET SHOTS. Need I say more??

jXzwG-IK0Xw0khZTPFsFxQ.review_text: My favorite place so-far for Happy Hour in the City. You buy one round of beer and get tokens for each beer to redeem a free beer before 8:30pm. If you don't make the time you can take them home and come back with them next time.  On the outside the place doesn't look like much, and it's actually a little small but I always seem to have a great time here!  I've seen two bartenders here and the guy is much nicer. Once he gets off around 8ish expect to be carded by the girl bartender. She doesn't mess around, even if you have been drinking...she'll still ask.

xADAW32u15sgA18Hfy9PsQ.review_text: Happy hour till 9pm. huge tv for MNF. good times.

rCuvDG-3Mo7jB1sJehZZsg.review_text: best happy hour in town: buy 1 drink and get a token to get another drink free  couple that with the fernet shots and you're in for a good time.

R2p221627ZK5IhFBVI0OzQ.review_text: I finally found my favorite neighborhood bar, a quick walk through the alley and I'm home which is a perfect stumbling length since I seem to enjoy their drink specials a little too much when I'm here.   I went here for the first time during the day with my roommate, we were the only ones there. The bartender hands us water balloons and informs us we need defense because we're in the line of fire. We got caught in a water balloon/super soaker fight with the bar across the street. A bloody mary, 2 fernet and sodas, 2 beers (these just being the drinks I consumed) and a few hours later my roommate and I left soaked in water and spilt beer.   I of course had to do my research and went back the next night to check out how the place was at night and I still loved it. Fun bartender, jukebox, photo booth, pool table and a small but not cramped bar. So far, so good.

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: This place "hosted" my *very first* DYL, and I'd have to say I was SUPER excited!!! I was already in North Beach visiting a friend who had surgery, so I thought "why the hell not? She's sleeping, might as well have a drink for her".   AND I WAS RECOGNIZED!!! Thanks to the manwhore who boosted my ego up like a damn puffer fish by recognising me in public as a yelper, we headed over to Columbus Cafe so I could meet-and-greet the people I had been harrassing and stalking on a daily basis online.  Carl was ever so kind as to purchase my drinks for the night--two shots of PATRON SILVER (note: Irish Bank no have-y), and a beer. I was able to ward off Amanders and her Fernetsluttish ways by playing the game "Pass the Fernet around, don't let it stop at you". It was almost like Hot Potato, only instead of burning your hands/getting out, you would be passed out on the floor vomiting and wondering why and how anyone could ever let you do that.  $3 Fernet shots = deal = bad idea.  The music was awesome, great for the Jaime who dances when she drinks. The bathroom was all kinds of strange, though--?? But still fun! It had a shower curtain...there was adequate room, and a POOL TABLE!! Now, I was too busy meeting and greeting, so I didn't get to play..but rest assured if and when I come back, there will be heads rolling at my sk1llz.   I still ended up almost puking at the end of the night, though. For that, 4 stars. It means it was a good night.

Q5p1GebACk8bLbCAbhjPCw.review_text: First time at this bar and felt right at home.  Happy Hour can't be beat - 2 for 1.  And if you're hungry Golden Boy Pizza is practically next door.

vTlojZMXP1SsYUit4urP7Q.review_text: This place was a sh:thole.  Maybe it was just because we stopped in during a football game, but the bartender was rude, at one point a "regular" started yelling because the bartender wouldn't serve him unless he paid cash (apparently a long overdue bar tab) and are drinks were terrible.  The advertise fresh squeezed Russian Standard greyhounds, it tasted like well vodka and he used a half a grapefruit in the press for our 3 drinks.  When you looked at them the first was dark pink, the second light pink and the 3rd was clear, I wouldn't have cared so much if it weren't that there were $8 drinks.  The place was filthy and sticky, I hear they have better specials during the week so maybe I'll give them a second chance, if I'm very very drunk.

h3w0zczOY4rETWz1FLwPPQ.review_text: Here's why you should give this bar your business: sfgate.com/cgi-bin/artic…

f81Y2EzuRqefayCrL1Ra3Q.review_text: Columbus Cafe is just ok.  The place is tiny and from what I saw, served mostly beer.  The bathroom line was intense for such a small place... It almost made me feel like I was at a club.  Chill, quiet, normal, no frills place. Just be wary of when it gets crazy busy!

vNlpdOzG7WpH2Wz0oNVuug.review_text: Oh man. All I remember about this place is this bitch bartender yelling at us to get out of the bathroom, saying that we don't all need to go together and blah blah blah.   We may have been on lush time, but I swear we were in and out of there in like under 3 minutes. I don't know what her freakin problem was.   And it was St. Patty's day! irish car bombs and guinness galore and you don't think we are going to have to frequent the loo at least once??? Jeez lady, we are paying customers, except next time we'll be paying somewhere else! Beeezy!

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: Love that this place does 2-for-1 drinks during Happy Hour. Except, beware of the color of your chip when you redeem your next drink because your second drink has to be of equal or lesser value. I didn't know that the first time and the bar tender wasn't nice about it. Whoops, looks like your going to have to "sit on that Guinness all night", bro.

92X37S-hY1cYhl4IgedpMA.review_text: I get off three and its a hop and a skip away from the financial so i can beat the rush, the best part about this bar is the two for one happy hour... does anything else really matter????  i think i still have tokens left over for this joint..

tmxIsLKcNd9qG6nbL6ONbg.review_text: Came in here for a late night beer as was hopping around the area. Good beers (and I'm all about extensive beer menus) and good prices, plus it was still open and bringing in people late on a Tuesday night.

iOjwFYpHWo7P0rqmIfLm9g.review_text: I think for those of you who know me...I am a classy girl. Classy with a C and not a K.   I DO love a dive bar, however, and feel mostly at home at a place like the Columbus Cafe...becasue of its unpretentious airs.  You can't rate this place on what the crowd is like- you never know what you are going to get here with that- but you will get a great stiff drink, you might play pool and you can always get in the photo booth with some strangers.  Our favorite friend- Summer is the manager here and she is so customer focused- you'll feel like you are in her living room.  The owner comes from a long line of Long shore Union members and a lot of those folks still consider this their place to hang...so for the girl looking to meet a Salty Sailor, Fireman or a guy who works with a lot of rope- this place is for you!

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: I love coming here for their two for one tap beers. Buy one and get a token for a second free one. The awesome thing is that you don't have to redeem it right then, you can come back during any happy hour (4-8, 7 days a week) and use it. Which is good for me since I often am great after just one.  One thing to take note of, though, is that you can't use the free drink at the same time. If you buy a beer and want to give the free one to your friend, unfortunately they won't let you (boooo).  Pool table in the back which is always a good thing.

XiVlH054UZ3A964ZIrBkPg.review_text: I am tall. I am white. I refrain from clapping when cheering because I can't hold the beat. When I was nine, I was subjected to three months of Advanced Russian Character Dancing, where I was constantly chastised for no flexibility or grace.  On all accounts, I am not made for dancing.   And yet, after a strong long island and some devilishly good vodka redbulls from the super chill bartenders at Columbus Cafe, I was providing the bar patrons with some real entertainment via my ballroom dancing skills to Heart's classic song, "Alone."*  I think that my time to be a superstar has finally come.   *Based off a hazy memory that is undoubtedly certain to be 100% accurate based on no facts whatsoever.

2_cvh63d0CM33n1cP-3YZA.review_text: Good 2 for 1 draft specials, and a jukebox for your own music, but it can get kind of crowded for my taste during peak hours because its such a small spot.

SBRh4JMlv64ZC8pp3Bidlg.review_text: Dear Chuck,  Last night I saw Vietnam Tom (a/k/a Epic Beard Man) exit Maggie Maggary's and gruffly announce that he was going to the Columbus Cafe.  This gives me hope.  All the best, Clyde

vtX_fsEbpSMYBQYHwbontA.review_text: This is an outstanding performance here in the place. The bar is awesome and very decorated place too. The staffs are so cordial and fast in their work. Wine collection is strong and rare. I will be back to the place again. Highly reocmmend it to my friends.

3K_kEI0iHKf-G8ePsBM4ZA.review_text: The ambiance was great, but unfortunately the only bar staff (this bald guy with a fedora and glasses) was the biggest dick to me and my entire party. He was abrupt, condescending, and overall unpleasant. Not coming back because of that guy.

ZDYUxVKv2dd3CpOlc1ahRQ.review_text: I love the Columbus. The bartenders are awesome, and somehow they manage to 'persuade' me to have more drinks than I initially intend to! Whenever I just stop by for a night cap, it turns out not just the one...  And for some reason the late Sunday nights I've been there have been just crazy. Not crowded at all, but those staying until the small hours.... usually compensate!!

sBf5IfUPxTowTdUebPZVTQ.review_text: Fun bar in North beach. The drinks we reasonably priced, the bar tenders were friendly, and the guy at the door likes the Giant's. All in all: a win.   The place had a decent sized crowd and we were still able to snag a table. They had TVs on with various News and Sports, music playing, and a bathroom = all crucial.

irw57xeOQP8ulpMGW06JCA.review_text: Delicious!!!! What more can you say??

BJWHEhjxxuBZ1HTtsUgBTQ.review_text: 2 for 1 beer happy hour.  That should say it all.... but wait! There's more! Fernet.  There, I said it.  Fernet.  I love Fernet and when I first started coming here it was $2 during happy hour, i think it went up but still, its there and people drink it (it is SF after all).  The crowd is mixed, lots of regular, good group of regulars that play pool and the juke box always has something interesting playing.  I wish I still worked around the corner, I still have some beer chips.  Good joint.

XQMaAvF3YUslCD-0tZY1xg.review_text: Stopped in on Tuesday December 27th, 2011 around 6:30 while waiting for a friend. They're daily happy hour - except for the North Beach Festival runs from 4 to 8 PM with 2 for 1 draft beers which runs $5 with taxes included! Otherwise Fernet shots were $3! Screaming deal for SF.  Becca, the bartender, who was Johnny on the Spot was wearing an interesting helmet and was always quick to offer a drink. When entering they had the Celtics vs Heat on the TV's, however, they were playing club music on the jukebox which was making some patrons leave as it was only Tuesday at 7 PM. Becca, did offer a few dollars to one of the patrons to put into the juke box to fix the music selection.  Otherwise, one of the patrons - who must have had too much to drink - young, blonde gal was throwing up outside at 7 PM and had everyone laughing - only in North Beach does this occur i suppose. Location is amazing as it's right next to Golden Boy Pizza, which has some of the best pizza in town.

a-CtXGkmHkaaXSvnOLFxOg.review_text: Really cool bar... the two drinks I had were delicious and strong, and the atmosphere was just what a bar in the city should be.  It was a little pricey but I guess that's normal for North Beach.  The people were friendly and I would totally recommend this place.

xHI0MUS26PbAs92LYWKvTA.review_text: I loved this place.  I loved the atmosphere, the bartender was really cool, they had plenty of beer to choose from on tap, there are plenty of televisions to watch, and it is roomy so you do not feel cramped. Definitely a great neighborhood bar.    The Wizard says; check it out.

gEUrtbRV0VLgwS3Da-CndQ.review_text: Decent location in the middle of North Beach.   Typically a very diverse crowd any night of the week, fair prices on a bar with decent-good selection. Beers on tap are where the stars are earned and lost with bars, here they lose one. With the amount of tap-lines they have, they could surely manage a better selection, however, during Happy Hour decent beers being BOGO make it pretty much your last concern.  Pool in the corner, people getting ridiculous, photobooth option or a piece of wood with a hole in it for drunken pictures out front. Check it out during HH

QRyXsigFa4R3p4iXab0AKg.review_text: Walked in and ordered a beer. Bartender was inconsiderate and didn't seem to want to be there but,but, he gave my me and my three friends free beer so I can't complain too much. Was very clean and the atmosphere was super fun. Was a good find and enjoyed my time.

ELpbKN6MrObbWoUdggUCJQ.review_text: If you can't make it here for their 2 for 1 happy hour, then there is really not much reason to come.  Although during happy hour it's great.  Overrated bar with zero personality and no attraction.  Maybe I just don't get it.

zaBX3i2WgmixzgQBwA33GA.review_text: I was happy to celebrate my 23rd Birthday here with some friends for late night drinks. The manager was SUPER nice (Janessa). I gave her a call last minute and explained how I am looking for a bar to having drinks with friends, she made the extra effort to help reserve a couple of tables for me and my friends.  She also was nice enough to give me my first drink on the house. When you have a bar ran like this, it's no wonder the place is packed.   They have a WIDE variety of beers on tap, and the place is warm and cozy. Their HAPPY HOUR is AWESOME. 4-8pm seven days a week. Buy one beer get a token to get one FREE! They accept the chips up till 9pm, so even after happy hour you can still drink FREE beers...pretty awesome!  They have a juke box with all different types of music. Moreover, they also have a pool table, and a nice size T.V. to catch up the the day's sports.   If you are in the area and looking to celebrate an event with friends and family. I would definitely recommend coming here.

_5uZ9Ur33MnFvpjeryyKMQ.review_text: This place is sort of hit or miss for me.  The bartenders aren't terribly attentive and I've been plenty of times (on a Friday, mind you) when it was pretty quiet and I was one of the only girls at the bar.  I know, I know, "But you're a girl!  Aren't you supposed to love that?"  Yes, I would if the pick-up lines weren't so bad.  On occasion though, the jukebox is hoppin, the Golden Boy pizza is pipin hot, and all my friends gather here for a super fun night.  Since the location is so central, and the drinks are reasonable, it's a good gathering place to start or end the night.

QDWVaK7QLAmSV0GJyc6g1Q.review_text: Golden Boy to Columbus Cafe is the best 1-2 punch in the city. If you make it during happy hour you likely find yourself leaving in the wee hours without breaking the bank. Top it off with a pool table, photo booth, and awesome crew of bartenders and I'm happy.

l7V5w_vf9xv74As3abZukA.review_text: Great spot to have a few beers & shoot pool with friends while watching a game on a non-weekend afternoon or night.  The bartenders are great & know how to take care of their customers.   And you are sure to run into familiar faces from the neighborhood at any time.

PAuzCcKBzwRkiQhdqS0ftA.review_text: Not a cafe. A bar.  Lots of cheap drinks.  Thats good drinks and cheap prices not bad drinks with cheap prices.  Internet jukebox allows you to find almost anything you can imagine to play while you knock a few back.  Yay

sFWRvq9jgh8Co2tmwm_6SA.review_text: This place is great. Great happy hour spot. Love the 2 for 1 drinks. Other bars have similar deals in the area.  Definitely a spot to drink up after a long day of sightseeing. Also a pretty good selection of drafts. Keeping this place on my list when I'm in the city.

q4bOVbSM9yb8RwIAcYedbQ.review_text: Great vibe, great service, great great bartenders i.e. Karlee, great two for ones happy hour every day.   Now that is something great! Great!

OqH85SAF0oLijVY_SeAk8A.review_text: Like cheers, I like a bar that knows my name. And though I work near by... Like around the corner literally, the bartender still never remembers our faces..   Gooood thing the happy hour is decent and within immediate reach.. Especially after work.

-0Nvk7jIo79LaxChQtDyLA.review_text:
The last time I was here, one of my friends said something rude to the bartender (who I happen to be neighbors with) and then we proceeded to get our asses kicked out. 
  We weren't on the street for long, when a couple of guido tools we talked shit to back in the Cafe started gettin' salty. One of 'em grabbed my buddy Mike by the throat and started shaking him. Before long, people were just swinging all over the place, and some guy threw his cell phone at my face, which just *barely* missed. I picked it up and did my best Kerry Collins impression and threw that thing waaaaay over to the other side of the street. Perfect diversion, as the tool dropped my buddy Mike.
  Fast forward 20 minutes, and we managed to sneak back and apologize, which netted us a couple shots of Fernet. On the house. 
  Gotta give some love for the redemption shot.
  The juke box is always playing something upbeat and fun and occasionally a live band will perform. Not necessarily the best-sounding space to see a show, but it doesn't sound horrible. Funny how everything sounds decent when you've been having 2-for-1 drinks since 4 pm. ;)
  The drinks are pretty cheap, the crowd is fun and as the night moves on, the whole place turns into a crazy dance-lovers dream. 
  Minus one star for the fact that every time I go here, I end up waiting in some line to use the bathroom. Unlike some patrons, I wasn't ok with just going outside and taking a whiz behind, next to, or worse, ON a parked car. What if that was *your* car?! 
  I'm not gonna be that guy!

lI_BQEP8HctfwKQQc18EhQ.review_text: Probably the best after work happy hour in town - get there as early as possible before it gets too crowded. They have 2 for 1 beers until 8pm and a great selection on tap. Bartenders are great, the girls are cute and the jukebox has a great selection.  The best part about this place is that they are next door to Golden Boy Pizza, so once you get some drunk munchies stop by for some of the best slices in SF.

doz_wwj6F6Ln9ykODiLtZA.review_text: I schlepped halfway across town to watch every Giants World Series game here. They've got great atmosphere, great regulars and a great Happy Hour special-- you buy 1 beer, you get a token good for a second one free. 'Nuff said...

_Idlsaw2hXJN8NtNWamt2Q.review_text: I made good on my threat to come to Columbus Cafe outside of North Beach Festival.  I gotta say, I don't mind this place at all.  It was lively, people were friendly.  Some cute young girl told me I was *incredibly hot with [my] joan jett thing going on, and [she's] not even gay either!*  I bought her a drink.  We met a lively bunch from Liverpool, had a lovely time playing some iphone truth or dare with them.  When "I felt the rains out of africa" came over the soundsystem -  within seconds the entire bar was singing along, quite loudly and quite badly.  The bathroom was roomy enough for two.

z-kyHYF6oUad7inUVG0Mzw.review_text: God I love this place.  The bartenders are awesome, Paul the owner is great.  I got to know them all over the years and they're flippin awesome.  $4 Fernet shots, 20+ beers on tab, and a pool table...I almost lived there for my first year in North Beach.  Hell, I still live there. Do yourself a favor and go!!

_lbgVbWTvxV9VTVWU0YnwA.review_text: I like the happy hour... and the girl that works during those times.  When that one guy works... yeah, you know who you are, you're not so friendly!  But, that's ok... we're there for the deals, not for the friendships.

0M6iVk5VtlS9wk45FfPvZw.review_text: It's cool. -but  I'm not sure how much original personality it has.  -for the area it's awesome.  I recco it to anyone that is around drinking in that part of the hood.  The bartenders are nice, but sometimes seem a little cheesy.  Apparently they have a pool team that competes!

1xvmDofA0MvWDSD2hJAvyw.review_text: Awesome happy hour.  Two for one drinks during happy hour.  Kinda dark.  Super casual.  Great bartenders.  Awesome jukebox.  Pool table in the back.  And I always forget they have a downstairs!  I think its only open on the weekends though.  But its' like an entire other lounge below.  Great bar.

RR-hNSxTUs4CSkGQZLEWyw.review_text: Happy Hour = Buy a beer and get one free.   Dodgy bar but with a BOGO deal I'm all good. Too far for my taste, but when I roll with my co-workers its always fine with me.

R4DVayqiW63jHle7AG_NXQ.review_text: Quite nice!  Went there for a couch surfing underground meeting/good bye party and was not dissapointed. They have a variety of different drinks... they had Campari and Midori, which was quite a refresher, it's crazy, usually I go into a bar and they carry one and not the other. Weird!  They made drink specials available for us (since we had a LARGE group of 40 + people!) and the bartenders were all really sweet, nice ladies.  -- We interrupt this review to talk a litle bit about bartenders-- When ordering a drink at the bar I made sure not to forget my pleasantries, I always ask them how they are and how their nights are going. You wouldn't believe how nice and sweet they can be after that. People who usually have trouble with bartenders often forget that they're people with feelings too, not just machines who's sole job is to look cute and keep the drinks flowing. --Now back to the review-- There were pool tables, ample places to sit and congregate and REALLY REALLY REALLY nice and friendly patrons. I will definitely be back. I never went in before because I thought it was one of those overpriced cafe restaurant type of establishments, boy, was I happily mistaken. Great bar all around!

CkhhGX0pkLcUmgpXVfx95g.review_text: Spend some time in this par this past fleet week... I was very surprised at the fun had by all here.  The bouncers were cool in--fact i'm almost sure i got one of them laid.   All n all i was too drunk to go into details on this but trust its a great recipe for a  random Saturday night in the city!!!

NZwGgyT2BVjfWm6h-orOrw.review_text: A great newly discovered North Beach watering hole. Amazing 2 for 1 happy hour, affable barkeeps, solid tap selection, good jukebox, pool table, plenty of TVs for the game, and an unassuming, down to earth crowd.   3 craft beers and a shot of Makers and my bill was only 16 bucks. Will definitely be back. Glad I stumbled across it.

iY41hl-J7Nw32spi0BalUg.review_text: Awesome hole in the wall bar a friend and I wandered into while visiting S.F.  Our first night there and we were in luck. We found parking right across the park and stumbled in here since I was dehydrated from the walk across the park. So glad we ended up here. Awesome drink specials; awesome people. I couldn't have asked for a better first night in S.F. Thank you folks for making my night memorable-somewhat ( blame the alcohol) . :)

sXLAy83l7EwdZjsYFbaq0A.review_text: My first visit here a few years ago, I really thought I was being taken to regular café, and was pleasantly surprised to find a dark, low-key, chill watering hole - complete with a couple of TV's, jukebox, and pool table.   Cool, friendly bartenders. They also have a great happy hour - buy a beer, and get a poker chip good for a free beer - but ya gotta use your chips by 9:00pm, so chug-a-lug. (I'm always finding random poker chips that the old man didn't use, in my purse). And, I just love their t-shirts and hoodies - adorned with a sexy pinup mermaid holdin' a cold one.  And, I love the photo booth... I got some good blackmail pics of the old man as a sexy blond!  We always end up making a stop here whenever we're in town. A café, it is NOT - A great little dive bar, it IS!

B4cJvWuf59j7XlTdexnVZw.review_text: Despite the "Cafe" in the name, this is only a bar.  Great 2 for 1 special every day 4-8pm on a nice variety of draft beers.  You can use your free beer chip until 9.  The place is a dive basically, but they have some TVs for sports, a pool table and it's close to Golden Boy Pizza for a slice or bring in some North Beach Pizza.  Smoking seems to be allowed and though I don't, I feel it adds to the "charm" of the place.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: A surprisingly chill weeknight spot, considering the two for one deal. Stopped in last night with friends before getting pizza at Golden Boy and heading to Cobb's for a show.   Buy one get one free draught beers till 8PM, and your token is usable till 9PM, which is awesome. I'm thinking it's a more laid back vibe because it's off the beaten Financial District path. If Columbus was on Montgomery or Market, it would get weird more often during the week, methinks.  I went in a few months ago with my friend who was visiting from San Diego and she loved it. We got shots and beers and their special of the night, Sweet Tea, and we got a tad wasted. But popped over to Golden Boys to soak up the booze. You can bring your pizza to the bar with you.   They have a juke box, photo booth, pool table, lots of TVs, and a downstairs area too for when it gets packed. Nice to have the option of escaping the douchery.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Surprisingly great bloody mary's, 2 for 1 beers between 4 and 8 PM even on the weekend, great beer selection (hoegarden, franzikamer, apricot ale, etc), nice bartenders, pool, great music, convenient location, love it!!! :)

8zQczqnkwWkLENdlMMdqBw.review_text: Great Happy Hour. I love to use my drink "chips" on cold nights

SapOcLmnu_E3WpCb0lYiKg.review_text: Let's say that your average bar gets three stars.  A bar doesn't need much more than alcohol, a place to sit your butt, and someone that will pay attention long enough to you to take your money and pour.  So, following is a list of things that make the Columbus Cafe earn those extra two:  1. 26 (or somesuch) "microbrews" on tap.  They have their own Columbus Cafe Amber, and they have Franziskaner. Cheers!  2. Friendly staff - the people behind the counter have been very cool each time I have been here.  One bartender recommended an iphone app (shazam), another one ran out to my table because I forgot my poker chip at the bar.  Which, of course leads me to...  3. 2-for-1 beers during happy hour.  Can I get a hell, yeah?  4. A pool table, and non-wankers playing pool at the pool table.  4 1/2. A disco ball over the pool table (it's the little things).  5. A jukebox that seemed to have a good selection.  I heard the Yeah Yeah Yeahs three times one night.  Of course, it was the same Yeah Yeah Yeahs song each time...  6. They accept credit cards, and don't seem to give you any crap about a minimum on the card (I've only ever charged for two beers or more, though, so I don't know if they'd balk at closing out after just one).  6. A clean toilet.  This cannot be overrated. Ooh, and there was a swanky velvet curtain as well.  So posh!

TSdV_lsddT4F3TJvmdmXag.review_text: Enter, stage left: Amanda C and her going-away-to-Paris-for-work-oh-darn-life-is-so-­hard party. Enter, stage left, five minutes later: two people mildly inconvenienced by Amanda C, for which Amanda loudly proclaimed something about being pond scum/parasitic/an amoeba/whatever, there was a lot of beer consumed yesterday, I DO NOT REMEMBER.  And then ENTER THE BEAUTY OF COLUMBUS CAFE: 2 for 1 beer happy hour, and if you don't use your beer tokens, YOU CAN TAKE THEM HOME AND REDEEM THEM NEXT TIME.  Amanda had a few beer tokens.  Guess who ended up with those free(ish) beers?  You are a smart reader.  Yay:  2-for-1 beer happy hour until 8pm. Naked lady photo hunt! Pool tables! Pretty decent music - although, seriously, patrons, Motley Crue and Van Halen? Buttrock makes the baby Jesus cry (I won't deny I know all the words to every song that was played last night, though).  Nay: Patrons with popped collars Too far away from my home in the Sunset  All in all - I've been several times, including one night in the first year of law school during Fleet Week, trying to find sailors to ogle - and it's always been a fun time.  Bringing your own sailor helps, though.

XaKHchLtf0Ypqlad0oMpRw.review_text: I came here after eating some delicious golden boy pizza next door and decided it was time for another shot. My friends and i came in on a Wednesday night at around 11:30, the bar had a decent amount of people drinking and it seemed like it would be like a cool spot to get some drinks on a Friday or Saturday night.   The shots were pretty cheap and they were filled to the rim, not much more you can ask for other than that. I will more than likely come back to this bar, it served me well and there were also some cute chicks in there, so thats always a plus!  Happy drinking

GR1A-sSEgU64aU30FWJhew.review_text: I used to get pulled here by my buddies when they wanted me to watch them get drunk and stupid...Well they got the drunk part here they brought the stupid part with them. Nice little bar with friendly bartenders and patrons.

zpmViTr7g_1Ig8jPO0VNSQ.review_text: I have a confession to make. North Star...I have been cheating on you.   It's been going on for a little over a year now and I really don't know what to say. I happened to go by the Columbus Cafe for NYE 2009 and after a few drinks, ended up having one of the best night's of my life. I told myself, this will be the only time I will allow this to happen...but a few weeks later, the neon sign in the sky beckoned me inside for just...one...more...time.  I couldn't say no! During the week, I was tempted with a buy one get one free happy hour and three dollar fernet shots. Then I somehow spent a wild and crazy Santacon pub crawl stealing kisses in the dark corners of the billiards area, and it was all over.   I assure you, it meant nothing...but I was wondering iNStar, if I can have you both as my favorite bars in North Beach? We can split our time...I'll come to you for Superbowl and Sunday funday, but on my birthday, I decided to rent out the CC Basement for a private party. For a small bar tab minimum, they are letting me bring my own food, DJ and have a private room for me and 50+ of my friends. I hope you understand.   I still love you NStar, but I have a secret lover called Columbus Cafe and I have no intentions of breaking it off.

H9uW3vt-lMQbvnNVubuwbQ.review_text: Always a stop when we"re in the area! Fernet friendly, and 2 for 1 pints till 9pm!! Bartenders have always been cool to chat with!

yiMJmGMwDiwlld39R2Tm-Q.review_text: This is one of my favorite bars in the city... There are $3 Fernet Shots, 2 for 1 beers every weekday, and I love all the bar tenders. Karlee, Danielle, and Janessa... all are beautiful and all know how to tend the bar. Deffinitly check this place out if your in the area.

HPa7MNIwUyV5QBHVMMXujg.review_text: Been to this place once....and only once. As you can imagine though it satidfied all my alchololic needs. The bartender was cute (I forget her name but she was blonde and tatted)...Anyway nice, small, cool bar with good quick drinks....Can we ask for anymore?....I think not.

hYWwocw-J4KdyGLrUlOYXA.review_text: While waiting for a table at Sotto Mare next door, my boyfriend and I went to this bar to chill and have a beer. We were lucky to be there at happy hour, where it was buy a pint, get one free. Super cool!  They had a pool table in the back so my boyfriend played with a few guys. The bar seems like a big local spot. It was already crowded by 8 PM lol. Overall, a chill bar with good happy hour and good vibes.

WJnEifJRkI6bCH2iw8brFg.review_text: Fun easy bar in NB... yes, it gets PACKED but with cheap drinks and yummy chips who cares.   Great spot downstairs for a private party... will be back!

VOYvD-kerR204k0WrR0J3A.review_text: So we went here last night with a group of people. It took 40 minutes to find a parking spot. Missed most of first half of the Warriors game. Anyway, we liked this place. There are pluses and minuses. You can get two for one drinks before 8pm. The place was very crowded. Mixed crowd. They play some music and have a few big screen tvs. It wasn't bad for watching the game, having a few laughs, enjoying the scenery and having a couple beers. The bad part was the parking. I guess we already knew that would be an issue. The one other bad spot was the bartenders. I don't know if they are always that slow, but there is a point when enough is enough. It seemed like they were just laughing and talking to themselves more than trying to pour drinks. There were two of them, the bigger one who looked pregnant and the really slow one. I would suggest going to the biggger one.  We would go back. Stay away from the smaller bartender. Oh and they didn't say thanks after we dropped off a tip each time. Sort of rude. In fact, I don't even think either of them smiled.

PyFyZ6aJcGD0iPMSo9ag3A.review_text: This is a great place to stop in for a beer. They have one of the best and most diverse (sometimes) beer selections (25 taps) in the area (one of the better in the city).   Generally - always - when wondering about the city if I am in the area, I will stop in for a lip smacking delicious pint (big supporter of the Tricerahops abd Racer Five which they carry regularly). They have a good amount of big TV's so if your in the mood to watch a game or an event is a nice place to come. The pool table offers additional entertainment, during the day it's easy to get a game in, but later into the night it becomes a little to packed to come  just for the pool. My favorite time to come is in the mid/early afternoon, not very crowded.   If you come here and you are hungry, a few store fronts down is Golden Boys pizza, I highly recommend (make sure you bring cash) a slice or three. You can grab pizza to go and bring it into the bar.   Happy hour is super unique! You buy a beer during happy hour and they give you a token (poker chip) good for a free beer (during happy hour). You can take it, you can use it then, or even for the eccentric  few - you can hoard them to build a tower.. (I have a few)..

xpRAjmgL-pIcIY_9iOpcQw.review_text: How can you not love a place with Tenacious D on the jukebox?  As divy as they get...especially Kenny's Lounge downstairs...which I'm sad to say is gone...but used to be you could smoke and shoot pool while getting blitzed on very stiff cocktails while being serendaed by the vocal stylings of the worst karaoke artists North Beach has to offer.  If only they'd had "Fuck Her Gently" on the karaoke.

aBlXIipUwzl3wCIFIrFY-g.review_text: I really enjoyed their happy hour. The bar is a little small with few places to sit but it was still cool. Love the buy 1 get 1 free beers. I'm a fan!

aON_SCN0U9G9OiHPye6pCw.review_text: Happy hour - 2 for 1 - nuff said. The place usually doesn't get the usual trash that shows up on Grant street for Fri & Sat night. Great place to hit up after work to get drunk for cheap.

PMbivTX8hrJ5E3kqhaDtcw.review_text: $3 fernet... how can you go wrong :0) Nancy, our bartender, was amazing and incredibly attentive and helpful.  She made sure we never had an empty glass and really made sure our group had a great night.  Usually went to grant and green, but I will definately be coming back here in the future.

wpazdZ37epyyUslec-ujcg.review_text: Owned by a friend's friend, Columbus Cafe is a locals dive bar. Located next to great Italian restaurants and a drunk person's heaven, Golden Boy, Columbus Cafe is a great bar to venture to if you're in the North Beach area. I only live a block or two away so after a bunch of tequila shots I just walked my ass home.   They have a pool table and photo booth. Unfortunately, I didn't get to try the photo booth out :( . Anyways, there is minimal seating; only at the bar and like 2 or 3 high tables. But everyone is just as content standing as others are sitting.  Will visit again I am sure.

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: It's amazing how many places I've learned about because of DYLs.  I came here for a recent DYL, and because I was sufficiently buzzed on the bubbly and some white, I'm not entirely sure how great or bad this place is.  What I do know is that someone bought me a beer, and apparently it wasn't the beer he expected.  While that was the fault of the bar or the orderer, I don't know, but I know the orderer is pretty on top of things.  It's not a huge bar, and I'd probably miss it walking down the street, but I'm always a fan of running into random exes (and I use the term ex very loosely)...provided we're still on good terms.  I wouldn't be adverse to going back, but I wouldn't make a point of doing it.  There are other places to get reasonably priced beer and hang with my friends...especially places where I don't feel so old.

tzCNZD_I-46eSHGpf3b9mQ.review_text: Pretty sweet spot with what I consider CHEAP DRINKS!!! ($5 cocktails) What is it about SF where I find their drinks and food so affordable (and BETTER) compared to LA. In LA, all our drinks are averaged at $12. Grr!! This place had more of a pubby-divey feel and great place to interact with peeps.

1EQjprcscCLDBJDAT6oDIA.review_text: The staff here is amazing, which makes this place a favorite! They obviously make great drinks, but they're also incredibly friendly and attentive, which makes all the difference in a bar experience - especially with so many bars to choose from in North Beach.  I recently forgot my wallet here late at night, and the staff held onto it and returned it to me the next day. I mentioned the experience to a colleague, who had the same thing happen to her at Columbus Cafe and also got her wallet back - that says something about the kind of people who work there (as well as how much fun it is, because people are constantly having such a great time that they lose their wallets).

zvKDfdMm6K_xcc1i4GT5Yg.review_text: Recently stopped in here during an all day bar hop. I had one Greyhound and I couldn't leave for a couple hours. I'm a sucker for fresh squeezed drinks , cool bartenders and awesome crowds. I'll definitly head here first next time I'm in the city.

6KpxOoUnQyYGTd3Fuwk_lA.review_text: I think I've been here just once.  It's super divey and kind of small.  Draft beers.  Pool in the back.  Since I'm a fan of dive bars I'll probably end up going again sometime!

wSufVW03qQTQr1kSZ5pdFA.review_text: Typical dive bar next to the amazing Sotto Mare in North Beach - a  few standing tables and a couple screens. We watched a sailing competition in Venice yesterday.  2 for 1 draft beers from 4-8, seven days a week.   Bartenders seemed friendly.

PAGIppDXVg12CyCa-gdLoA.review_text: 2008 started off with two very pricey beers at Columbus Cafe.  $13 for two beers!?  $6.50 per beer?  $0.54 per Ounce?  Damn, thats some expensive beer. Thats like London prices.  Man, you fools in North Beach must be ballers to not be fazed by prices like that.  --- UPDATE a couple hours later --- I just got a message from one of the owners informing me that only the Chimay is that expensive. I think they need a bright, blinking warning sign on the Chimay that says: "I'm SUPER pricey! Only for North Beach Ballers!" I'm bumping them to 4 stars in anticipation of that sign, and because they seemed like a reasonably cool bar with a cool basement lounge.

LkM20gbDNUqXnGM1tLldlg.review_text: If you're in North Beach looking for a good spot to hang out and grab a drink after work, Columbus Cafe is it.  Their happy hour is second to none...buy 1 beer and get a chip that's good for a second beer of equal or lesser value, redeemable at ANY future happy hour. So, if you're like me and frequent this place a lot, you'll eventually amass a stash of chips that you can use when you're short on cash, but still want to go and get a couple of beers after a hard day at work. Just don't forget to show the bartenders some love and be sure to tip on the chip.  While you're there, pick from a wide selection of beer on tap, as well as a full bar (yes, they have cheap Fernet shots, for anyone foolish enough to actually drink the filthy stuff). Be sure to try the house Amber Ale...it's fantastic, and something you're not going to get anywhere else.  There's also a pool table and a couple of TV's that will be showing the big game if it's on, and whether it's the jukebox or the bartender's ipod playing, there's always good music blasting.  And if you need a snack after all that drinking...Golden Boy pizza is just down the street.

ASi-DVa3LezKHCTOra_YAA.review_text: Evan is a solid bartender.  Very knowledgeable and friendly.  I was able to watch a Packer game and enjoy the locals tales of the previous nights craziness and laugh along with them.  This place made me feel at home.

XJhmTEAJuYRgIP4b9wMcTw.review_text: Fun, friendly, and full of people, even on Xmas night who love to tell a story and hear one in return.  Give it a try!

qsJL1wqlNOrxvp_ItIV6Aw.review_text: So happy I stumbled upon this spot just in time for football season. First off they have Sunday ticket so you can watch all NFL games at once. They have a bunch of TVs and even play the sound for niners games. Bartender was super friendly and made a killer Bloody Mary for me, my girlfriend had a fresh squeezed greyhound. They also have tons of beers on tap with good variety. This is definitely going to be my new Sunday spot

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: Nothing special crowd, space, drinks. There are better places to spend your hard-earned cash.

ubF5zarbyXJVMTOZrSUFyQ.review_text: Ok, this place is a great place to come to if you're a little short on dough.  2 vodka tonics for $11. Whaaaaaaaaat?! Drinks are super cheap compared to other bars, but that's what makes this place great.   And in my previous review of meeting fun/crazy people and the unexpected, I met a very forward lady in the restroom. She taught me how to work my pectoral muscles and made me feel her left and right ones as she showed me the difference in the working of those muscles. Very interesting. You get a diverse crowd here though.   The front doorman was also very nice and offered to take our picture outside with the Columbus Cafe stand. Thanks!

yJpv-WotvnyB-kvTwbycNA.review_text: Great place! Awesome beer/coffee/food and friendly service. Glad my fiancé and I chose to come here. ;)

dSnRjLEwAtqVAlz9NEbp3A.review_text: This is a great little bar. They have a small dance floor downstairs, friendly, quick bartenders, and cheap shots of Fernet.

MQL7RSeMrcmPdqf7ilF3zw.review_text: Great place to hang out with friends!  Back seats are comfortable and you get drink chips (vegas type chips) for a free drink.  Bar tender is very chill!! Great dive bar!!

R872fZFQmb9WPi3UaNkvew.review_text: Historical value, 2-for-1 happy hour, and attractive bartenders are good in my book.  $4 for a fuckin' Pabst in a non-nightclub, non-restrictive-entry, neighborhood bar setting is most definitely NOT good in my book...in fact, it tempts me throw my book through the front window.  Yeah, you ain't going blind. You read that right:  $4     for         a            P               B                  R                     !!!!!!!!!  Shit, throw in a tip and you're basically paying the price of a full PBR 12-pack at Safeway...for one fuckin' glass of Pabst with too much foam and air on top. Why bother? Stay at home and ignore the usual nighttime clientele of postgrads, fratboys, and off-duty waitstaff looking to score.  I might be tempted to let it slide and throw 'em 2 stars for that 2-for-1 happy hour, but mix in the shitty digital jukebox* and they should count themselves lucky to get one star and no window damage.  JG  * "Internet jukebox" directly translates to "owner is a bland and non-committal man lacking distinctive class or tastes" in this or any bar. Scrap 'em! They're crap!

vsaHsatoJrQjChsprt4Kxg.review_text: Used to go here after work in the financial district and get the 2 for 1 beer specials.  Get a slice of pizza next door and you're good for the night.  Played plenty of pool games here.  damn, i miss living in the City.

DStFb_pjHJ0jtdWkXhVjMA.review_text: Yes it's a dive. Love it. Yes 241. Til 8pm. Had prohibition beer how appropriate...  Best local hole in the neighborhood...give it a try!

dj-a8NPdDsPcBcSES2eflQ.review_text: Thursday night drinking?  Wow.  Haven't done that in a while.    So long farewell fellow co worker!  Ah the only reason I get out on a Thursday night.  Parking is easy when its at 11 at night!  We all got our drink on and sad goodbye at the CC.    This place was so cool on a Thursday that there was about 4 locations when the homeless came in to clean up the drinks.....?  Haven't seen that before.

MvoJm96n-KJqmyrpEmyTVQ.review_text: Amazing happy hour! 2 pints of on tap beer for $5 and you can keep the token for your second pint and bring it back any time during happy hour (I think it might be good until even an hour after at 9pm!?). There's a pool table and everyone is nice. I would definitely recommend this place!

CFL1vDhDfriHesGPJX09tg.review_text: Why had no one told me about this happy hour? San Francisco friends you fail me. I just may have found my new favorite dive. I love this place! An amazing selection of beers on tap. But best of all, happy hour is 2 for 1 beers! AND it goes 'til 8! We're not just talking bud light here kids--Leffe, Magic Hat, Big Daddy, Wiedmer. $5 for two belgian beers?? I'm sold.   When I went in with my gal pal around 5 on a Tuesday the place was virtually empty. It was great for catching up, chatting with the people next to us and watching sports highlight reels. The bartender was super friendly to boot.   If only I lived in North Beach Columbus Cafe would totally be my Cheers!
