pdML8Iv3MxVbQ1T94xZbiQ.review_text: My favorite place to watch the good ole' Giants play! The best team in baseball deserved to be watched at a great bar and no where in this city is better than Columbus Cafe!   Cheap drinks, tasty food, plenty of tv's and above all a lively crowd!   Win or loose everyone still boozes at Columbus Cafe :)

qstOF_b3pvyVPyq4Qsyw-A.review_text: Came here twice so far for happy hour. The BOGO beer is definitely my achilles heal and plus they have franzikhaner!!! I love that beer!  The place is divey and the bathrooms are kinda gross but hey its a dive bar. Definitely located in a good area with plenty of food and other bars. The bartender is friendly and helpful if you are looking for good suggestions or something new.  I suggest taking public transit or cabbing as it is north beach.

pdnNeemAs7mcAg3n_UKeUw.review_text: Franziskaner Weissbier, naghhhh  Cool place, gets a lil' rowdy, killer happy hour specials, and surprisingly spacious... considering bars in the area.

yTNuMXKuqbgrn88Q-iwIlw.review_text: I'm nervous about doing a review on CC because everyone seems to talk about what's going on upstairs when the action is really down there - I mean downstairs. Make a left right after the bathrooms and it's like you're going down your grandparents basement to a makeshift/shxt living room. It's awesome! Live DJ and the oldest couches around to lounge sink in. Tony the bartender is great and will let you try a few of his lucky hats if you're not a rude asshole with too many stripped shirts. This is the ultimate North Beach dive hole for sure. Try it out for yourself.-no lines, on one bumping up against you, cool beats and enough seating for all.

yfG8hiLv0mA0ltTNXERuYQ.review_text: Stopped in here for a few drinks and to catch some of the Giants game, and had a great time! We had never stopped in before because it's always so crowded, but this time we spotted two open seats at the bar and grabbed them! Had a few good drinks, talked with some other friendly customers and the bartender, had a good time and will definitely be back.

nsawcqioX0NDmqsDsM8L4w.review_text: Sunday Funday  Highlights *A real bar *Great happy hour *Fernet *More Fernet *And more Fernet *Great Ipod playlist provided by the Bartenders *Happy hour beer token  Downers *ummmmm next to Golden Boys? *Fernet *More Fernet *And more Fernet  My bartender friends took me here on Sunday Funday.  Drinking when I have to work the next day.  Monday going to be interesting.  I just hope I don't staple my tie to the reports.  This is a bar with a bar feel.  A little on the small side, but once you start drinking that will all melt away as you stumble down stairs to the other part of the bar.  Play some pool  on the small table and throw some change in the jukebox.  They have TVs all around for your viewing pleasure.  To Sunday Funday!

wAeREtzI0ca_QCQiuXDwIQ.review_text: Classic dive bar.  You buy one beer, get a token for a free beer later on when you make another purchase during happy hour.  Gotta love it.  Great place to meet old friends and to make new ones, unpretentious and totally chill.  Come in a t and jeans and sandals...grab a beer, take a sip, and relax.  You've arrived at the right place.

Z_yi5X0C-yFMA_sTKFvesA.review_text: 2 for 1 beers, seven days a week from 4-8!  It sounds like I'm a spokesman, but it blows by mind.  It may be me, but I can't understand why anyone would give this anything less than a five.  BOGO beer is amazing--cherish it.    It's a "dive," sure, but for SF only.  Most places in the world this place would be considered a normal bar with no pejorative attached.  Four years in and this city still confounds me at times.  It's a bar, you're there to drink.  If you require more amenities, pay for it.  Can't discount a place because you get more than what you pay for.  And, "tip on the chip."  I was there today and saw a few douches fail to tip on their "free" beer. If anything, be extra-generous--you just saved five dollars.

Un138zBMZ-FviGziY9oLFg.review_text: It's part of my circuit when I go to san fran!  red's place,li po, buddha,vieni vieni, geno and carlo, and columbus! Plus kennedys pub later if I'm not too wasted

YrgVqQKtKFcJGg5RoE8cvg.review_text: Looking for a local hang out with a great happy hour in North Beach?  Look no further than Colombus Cafe, cause it's the best in the neighborhood!  Two for one tap beers?  If you don't have time for the second they'll give you a token to use later?  What the hell more could you ask for?  You picky, picky Yelpers;)

KyGkyqSPuJW-Sq7OXPVu2w.review_text: Decent Dive bar in North beach. My friends and I went here after a Friday Giants game. The interior of the bar is pretty nice. I like how the bar is next to Golden Boy Pizza,when  the bars closed we got pizza at Golden Boy Pizza!

ODSH1it5oAUPu2clIgOvyg.review_text: This is just a regular dive bar. Nothing too special about it. It does have a pool table that you can play for $1. You can also watch some sports while you hang out. The service was okay, and if you use your card, there is a $15 minimum. For some reason, they give you poker chips for every drink purchase. I have no clue why they do that, it's pretty gimmicky. And they also make sure you keep those souvenirs, like they will hunt you down and make sure you have your chips. Why???? Not a bad place to hang out while you wait for the other bars to open  Update: Karlee, I'm guessing one of the bartenders here, messaged and informed me about those poker chips. Apparently you can redeem them for free drinks during happy hour. If anyone wants free drinks, I left about 6 of those tokens near the pool table haha I wish I was aware!

5XO4iBD2JlZIoym9fDMV6A.review_text: This place ROCKS,   Been here about 10 times over the last year.   Nice local dive in Northbeach. It has a great happy hour with cheap fernet shots, and buy one beer get a token for another. The bartenders here rock are friendly and sweet. The crowd here is real legit. No fake wanna be's, just normal workforce getting off of work who want to mingle and have a nice cold beer. Everyone should stop by and grab 2 for 1 beers @ 5 a pop, and a 3 $ fernet shot to give u that herbacious happyness!! :)

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: This place wasn't good or bad - I'm indifferent!  I had fun because I was there with a bunch of friends on a bar crawl, but I can't say what the usual crowd is like.  A couple of my friends had purchased tickets to get discounted drinks on the pub crawl, but I found that it was unnecessary.  Drinks were cheap to begin with (:

QsM6BSlosKUpMnH9iAgvZA.review_text: Looking for a nice bar to have a beer, a dark sports bar with happy hour to 8:00 is always a bonus. 2 for 1 beer tokens. GREAT!! It is nice when you have a beautiful girl serving you beer from behind the bar ... it is a little weird when she is 6 months pregnant and schlepping ice from the back room to replenish the bar. Nice local bar, a good selection of beers but no Boddingtons on tap... kudos to the bartender for knowing the brand.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: another little north beach dive... the only time i come here is after the big 'NB Beer & Oyster' festival. its the only time it has a decent crowd. otherwise its just a small little bar with a pool table and some TV's.

h0FPJR1jCDpwq0C4t8ArLA.review_text: This might be my favorite bar in North Beach to grab a casual drink.  Bartenders are usually great, the beer selection is never ending, and it's rarely crowded for football on Sundays (they also have Sunday Ticket).  Oh, and bonus points for having fresh squeezed juice.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: If you come to this old North Beach bar for happy hour you get a drink chip for every beer you order. They are pretty high quality chips so you can either cash them in or save them and use them next time you want to play poker.   I recommend saving them and getting the hell out when happy hour comes to a close, because this carriage turns into a pumpkin after about 8:00.   The evil stepsisters take the place over around this time, looking to take Prince Charming home for a quickie. However Prince Charming is generally downstairs dancing at this point as a prequel to barfing on their not so glassy slipper as the evening progresses.   I assume this has something to do with the $3 Fernet shots they offer up, all of the time. Or maybe it has something to do with the internet jukebox, which, in the earlier hours can be a fairytale, but as the evening progresses and the douche bags show up to the ball, turns into more of a nightmare.   The bartenders are super nice and the happy hour is good, but save this destination for early in the week or early in the evening if you want a happy ending.

ZHyfXWIUUtBsCat-DT9PWQ.review_text: The old faithful never fails. ...  And rene had 4 tokens in her bag. ;)

daEKn0SlW3j3-8zAXx3xBA.review_text: I was standing out front with one of my friends we were both trying to capture an image down Green st with our digital SLR's. So this guy walk up to me and says are you from Spain? I said no  I am from here. He then proceeds to tell me the bartender inside was admiring my boots and she wanted to know where I bought them.  He then invites us to come in for the two for 1 pints happy hour. The bartender was very friendly and cool. The patrons were a hoot. A great spot in North Beach for happy hour.

7mzACXQ5F4EduE9jF_tI-g.review_text: My Tuesday began with a conversation with my girlfriend about Taco Tuesday, and our wonderful plans to stuff ourselves full of tacos, burritos, and any other 1 dollar mexican specialty.   Miss Nicole L. decides to make her way from NB to the Nob for tacos at Nicks. After a late return home from work by me, and a missed bus (silly 12) it came down to one fact... if we went to Nicks Crispy Tacos right now, we would have to wait in line for a while for food.  FUCK THAT I'M STARVING. OK I say, I will walk to NB and we can go do beer and pizza at Golden Boy, and it's not really a downgrade from taco tuesday if it's golden boy.   So shortly thereafter Nicole L and I dominate our beer about as fast as we inhale that glorious slice of pizza. I look to Nicole and say... I'm not ready to go home, wanna hit up a bar?!   While we had the motivation to go out after food, we did not have the motivation to go far. Well Columbus Cafe is right next door, lets stop there. Upon entering it didn't seem promising (I have been here before, but tonight was slow, I mean it was a Tuesday). Shortly after we sat down Nicole and I played the "I don't know what I want" game, only because we were looking for the cheapest drink out there.  Dropped out of heaven land two strongly accented Bostonians who tell the bartender, put these girls drinks on here too. Suddenly, as if a fog had been lifted, NIcole and I knew what we want, "JAMESON AND GINGER!!! JACK AND DIET!!!!"   The night wasn't complete without a few shots of whiskey and 3 games of Wii bowling... yes that's what I said, WII! Columbus Cafe is BRILLIANT with this idea! If you provide me with free competitive games, I will most definitely be purchasing another round.. or 2.   Columbus Cafe, thanks for giving me a great weekday spot! XO

a8N9dAsIZHQNKZZZehRACg.review_text: Happy hour 2-for-1, save your tokens for a late night. Pool table in the back, the music is usually good. The crowd is nice, although it can get yuppified on the weekends. But nonetheless, a great place to have a drink and grab a Golden Boy pizza on the way home.

ep3MfPqeQX0FdT0G5ne4FA.review_text: My first experience at this place sucks! Place looks dirty. Bathroom smells really bad. Their private room is horrible. Drinks are over priced! Snobby workers. The only person who was friendly was their security guard at the entrance door. Would I come back to this place, hell no.

I-02Mz45H7siHsjjgVxPgQ.review_text: Well this was another cool bar I discovered during Santacon and I have to admit this place looks fun. A bar that  has been there for years was a great place to stop and have a nice beverage while the madness was going on outside. I didn't get a chance to stay too long because it was getting very crowded and I started to feel like a sardine.... I plan on checking out this bar again very soon!

rO2YKN1PqAJjd6YgP0PM0A.review_text: Great selection of beers. Drinks are strong and service is great. Friendly people.   A few cons are - frat central - I felt like I was in the Marina. Tiny pool table in the back so when it is crowded (it usually is) you get to be jabbed by pool sticks if you awkwardly try to stand near the back of the bar.

cs1GMqTt5eGmLqQyPijYcw.review_text: The bartender was totally flirting with me and gave me a free shot of their infused vodka.  Deelish!  (The vodka and the bartender)   Then my boyfriend at the time came up and gave me his bag.  WTF?  Anyway, the bartender goes "is that your boyfriend?" and when I answer in the affirmative, he goes "OUCH!!!" and acts like a moody 13-year-old dick the rest of the night.  Amazing happy hour (2-for-1 beers) and the infused vodka will keep me coming back and braving the awkwardness of a bartender scorned.

cMICirZm69WlJHyasuUPTg.review_text: Normally, I love Columbus Cafe. I have been here a few times and it's usually a fun place.   We stopped by here last night, which happened to be St. Patrick's day. Two of my girlfriends and I were in the bathroom, you know the one that has the curtain as the door.... ya that one.   If you know us, then you know how fast the three of us are in the bathroom at bars. We were in there for seriously no longer than 5 min.   All of a sudden the door comes flying open. The bleach blond bartender starts screaming at the top of her lungs, in our faces, that only 1 girl is allowed in the bathroom and people want to use the bathroom. Excuse me?!... uh ya, we are THOSE people who need to use the restroom. Paying customers REMEMBER? She continued to yell at us on the top of her lungs, until we walked out of the bathroom.   That whole experience changed Columbus Cafe FOREVER for me. I seriously don't think I will ever be back. I have never felt so awkward and well insulted in my life! And all over using the god damn bathroom.   That bartender is bad news. This IS the reason why I don't like girl bartenders.

HtZUb1bbN-lExBuyLdVD0g.review_text: As dive bars go this place is awesome.  Lots of beer on tap and friendly staff.  I I am in the city I will be here for at least one drink.

v8KXET42yEGlMRbKoQOp7g.review_text: This place is a great place to go for a beer but not feel like you have to get all dressed up which is rare for a bar in North Beach.  The bartenders are fast, the beer is reasonable, and they have PHOTO HUNT and a juke box. I have never been here for a happy hour but it is pretty cool on Saturday nights. It gets crowded but you don't feel like you have to fight to to order a drink and the noise level is such that you can hold a conversation with someone and understand what they are saying.  Update: Am adding another star for the fact that it is 2 for 1 during happy hour!

QuZbJquRtbY9O9JrB9NpxQ.review_text: @Columbus_CafeSF There are so many great bars around here...they really should export some to other cities that are sorely lacking great local bars.  Spent an hour or more here awhile back nursing a glass of scotch with a friend toward the end of one of the long evenings that seem to victimize me whenever I am in North Beach...ok, I'm a willing victim but that is beside the point.  @onlyinsf #SFO

E3CmcQiN8YeQbfsCnNv_cQ.review_text: Great, great, great Happy Hour spot!  2 for 1...Come on...doesn't get much better than that!  And it's not on just cheap beer, they have some great drafts to choose from.  Although it can be dangerous and at some point you might say, "No, no I just want one!" but when that point happens you won't even remember what is going on.    4 stars because the ambiance isn't the best, but I mean it's a sports bar, what do you expect!  Don't go there if you are looking for valet and a coat check... You will not be received well.    I would definitely recommend this place for an excellent happy hour experience and the best part....RIGHT NEXT TO GOLDEN BOY!  Hellooo...enough said.

GawyLibaMGt3PCsv-hI5sA.review_text: I love this place. My local neighborhood bar.   I bonded with the bartender over MIA and Mickey Avalon. Whenever Kelly bar-tends, she plugs in her ipod.... and we rock out to music while she pours us endless fernet shots with ginger backs.....the industry drink that only the pro's and bartenders can handle. Are you man enough?

cVc4PCDC7Qj_NZKKogPs5Q.review_text: This is my favorite bar in North Beach.  The bartenders have always been super cool and the atmosphere is friendly.  Non HH prices are pretty solid and I've always had a good time.  Decent beer selection.  If you need any more details then you are too picky.

Q4RsL67tkjfRclgTfTPUdA.review_text: I really like this bar.  The have lots of good beers on tap, as well as a pretty decent liquor selection.  Prices are pretty good considering the location as well.  The bartenders are friendly and pretty quick with the service even when it is packed.  On the weekends this place is cracking.  However I did stop through with some friends for a couple beers on a weeknight once and I have to say that it was pretty dead.  When raging it in North Beach I do usually try to stop through here for at least a beer though.

FxqfMKUXHlrtTTZC2xexbQ.review_text: I have never in my 32 years witnessed such unprofessional and ridiculous behavior on the part of a bartender. The bartenders name is Carly and she should be fired if Columbus Cafe wants to stay in business. After a relatively laid back evening at this establishment, my friends and I ordered a last round of drinks. Immediately upon paying for them, Carly instructed her bouncer to remove our drinks (meanwhile her friends still sat comfortably at the bar with their beers).They proceeded to yell at us to get the $&@# out and then Carly yelled some very offensive language at me insulting where I was from. She then proceeded to spray me in the face with her seltzer gun, unleashing a rambling of profanities. She then came out from behind the bar and threw a metal bottle opener at my friend. It was shockingly uncalled for and completely unacceptable. I am appalled.

V6n7b90ijL6PhCGvfDt43Q.review_text: i feel a little too old being here.  it's definitely your typical north-beach 20-something crowd but it's a fun dive bar with a great jukebox and a friendly atmosphere.  good place to pop in for an after work beer.  beware of the scary local men who like to hang out there though...last time i was there, one guy had really bad gas and prectically cleared the place out!  haha!

IRyIguNlHptFCC4JZEkg4w.review_text: Just left this place and I give it 5 starts for how much we spent.  4 beers and 2 shots of Jameson = $22!  That's dirt cheap compared to other bars I've been to around this time.

ItxM2SMn40Vmmsqa_8b4ZA.review_text: 2 for 1 pints till 9pm is all I have to say.  I spent $10, and received 2 pints of Tricerahops, which is such an awesome beer.  Than followed it with 2 pints of blue moon because the IPA was hella filling.  Awesome prices, and friendly staff.  Recommend!

TlUqnP5QPbKXfHRNM_fa3Q.review_text: As we were tramping through North Beach we stopped off at this rad dive bar. Great 2 for 1 beers and packed with locals getting their drink on. Affordable and great bartenders. I regret not buying a shirt, they were really cool also

mP6MeNAciCpSSgvgWoutFQ.review_text: This is usually a cool environment. I've been here once before on another trip and specifically located this bar to go again. Unfortunately, the bar tender tonight was so high/drunk that he didn't seem coherent enough to take our order. Had a huge attitude problem and acted like it was a problem to serve us. I got the impression that this may have been a "locals only" issue. It was a rather hostile environment. Walked out and left. Completely ruined the experience and I would not recommend this dive to anyone. Not worth your money!

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Always wanted to try this place but never made it in for one reason or another...mostly because it's always packed and hubby prefers mellow places where "you don't have to wait forever or fight to get attention for a drink".  One day we'll have to take advantage of their Happy Hour, it's just too tempting to pass given how close it is to home.  Finally had the chance on Fleet Week.  As we were greeting sailors and thanking them, two of them were outside and I asked if we can buy them a drink and off we went.  It's a cool place indeed and it's bigger than I thought it would be.  The bartender was friendly and prices aren't too steep.  I think for 3 drafts and a shot of vodka were under $20?  I can't be sure since hubby paid, I just down my shot and chatted with the sailors a bit before we moved on to thank other servicemen in the area.

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: this place reminds me of amber, one of my best friends from college and maybe the funniest person i know.  she was my chubby mexican friend (she really wasn't) and i was her, er, korean friend.  when we both worked in the city, we'd meet at the token bar pretty frequently for 2 for 1 happy hours because she loved/hated one of the bartenders.  we'd drink stellas and talk about her brother who looked like george clooney (drool),  what we were going to do with our lives, whether she should move back to LA and why i was dead inside.  good times.  i went back recently on a weeknight and i would recommend not doing that.  this place is fun for happy hour but if you stay beyond that, you do so at your own peril.

Ub7_eU6tHduSPQVHdeLDOg.review_text: AMAZING happy hour.....come early get a spot at the bar and save those poker chips to keep buying drinks...also try there brew that they make it is really good

PZvyqN7sgHI-o4f8z7O-ZQ.review_text: There's really nothing spectacular to say about this bar, apart from the fact that it's a solid place to drink in North Beach. Great beer selection, drinks are good and stiff, lively atmosphere, and best part... during happy hour they give you a chip for every drink you buy, which is redeemable for... another drink! And you can take the chips home and use them on another night (though why you'd do that, I have NO idea...)

fy9_Fneu9b55iLSRk3YjYw.review_text: Came here with a date last night after dinner. The drinks are strong and the prices are reasonable. Kelly is an awesome bartender. She's really friendly and accommodating, and even took a shot with us after I told her I was new to the neighborhood.  I was also introduced to Fernet. Let's take it back to SAT classes in high school: analogies. Absolut : Grey Goose as _____:Fernet. Answer: Jager.   I can't say I'm a huge fan of Jager, but this was after my 3rd round of drinks, and I was feeling a bit adventurous, so I went for it and it was okay. If I were on my 5th round of drinks, it wouldn't have been a good idea, but I would definitely come here for another one...or two...or three.   One of my new favorite spots with chill bartenders. Can't wait to try their happy hour!

DfWF5fnzufqzP9smf4oaHA.review_text: A chill dive'ish like bar in the North Beach area. Good beer and booze available. A pool table and a few seating areas for everyone. All the people that work here are super nice and pretty fast at serving everyone. Even on their hectic Sunday afternoon and evening during their happy hour time.

pHwlLUKTfB2kzBPRV0N4Ng.review_text: Excellent value for a SF bar. There are some serious drunks frequenting this establishment, but it adds to the dive bar atmosphere. Highly recommended.

agBczBvwLZR4_svBpNX-Wg.review_text: Nothing beats a buy one get one free happy hour! It gets really crowded, so getting there at the beginning of HH is a better way to go.  I always love a bar that has Racer 5 on tap!

BHzUHvI1f85Z6urstaZvJQ.review_text: I love this dark old bar. Love the atmosphere. Love the people(with the exception of the extremely fucked up drunk chicks.) Love the bartender, big tall drink of water was the nicest and coolest guy! Awesome selection and cheap prices! Cant wait to come back. XOXO.

FQN6HYUKduEjBYIHps_SCQ.review_text: 2 for 1 beers... they get pretty specific about the poker chips they use for redeeming the 2nd drink, but all in all a good deal and some cool people.... meaning I randomly ran into other friends I wasn't out with when I came in here. Good times.

gjfcfzrYZ0O1xINHtnQKiA.review_text: I'm not a big fan of bars, but this is one of the joints for a good drink with a friendly bartender while shooting some pool.  Service is good for recommending drinks especially to the ladies.  Happy hour deals with 2 beers for $5 make it worth visiting.  It's in the heart of North Beach and close to all the major bus lines in case you need to get to and from the place.  Parking is tough on the street.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Hands down best happy hour in SF. I never seem to be able to rid my dresser of the 2 for 1 casino chips they give out here. Good crowd and decent place to watch a game.

OO7v2zxAQbkj432uve08ow.review_text: Pros:  Very solid place overall. Strategically located (center of NB). Pool tables. Probably in the top 3 for happy hour. Near Golden Boy pizza. People in general are happy.  Cons:  Parking. Herding during peak hours (to be expected of course). Not good for dancing. Hard to get a table (there's only 3) making it bad for groups.

E9m9adcWg9h8mRX9idm9Qw.review_text: This was the first bar I visited after moving up to San Francisco. I'd been no stranger of this place, had frequented it a couple times visiting. My dad even told me he used to come here all the time in the '70s and '80s for happy hour. But this time was special, since I was now a resident, and coming from Irvine (the land with no soul) it was the most rewarding feeling to see people out laughing, drinking, eating pizza, loitering on the street, and know this was home.   Great happy hour spot, 2-for-1 beers on tap until 8pm. They let you cash-in your saved chips for drinks until 9pm, or you can take your chips with you and save them for another happy hour. (Chips are customized Columbus Cafe, so I wouldn't recommend trying to use generic poker chips for a free drink.)   Crowd is mixed, pretty chill, not your standard tourist NB or barely legal Saturday night Kel's bar binge drinking, frat boy crowd.   Besides happy hour, I prefer coming here on a lazy Sunday to watch a game. But, I admit, there are those times that I find myself lingering here after happy hour on a Friday night and singing to Bon Jovi on the jukebox. Good thing there's Golden Boy next door to lure me away when Journey starts to play.

64J57rMLWzaC_IJW8_S6ug.review_text: I stumbled into this bar on a weekend b-day getaway with my best friend. We were drunk and lost walking around North Beach and just so happened to see the Tamale dude we met the night before at Vesuvio, the bar next to City Lights book store.   Anyway, we decide to go in, because, hey if you can find that guy, his cheese and chili tamales are f**king amazing, even if you find them in your purse the next morning and eat them for breakfast, which I did.   Anyway I got an awesome shirt there with a naked mermaid on it serving beer, like a true turist. And also, the lovely bartenders served us many, many creative shots.  We ended up having a dance of with a swedish guy and then walked home happy with many new friends, and tamales.   I will surely visit this bar every time I am in San Fran.

pbhQDJ2h3VCTu0bxSzFIsw.review_text: OK boys and girls of the drinking age. let me begin by saying "happy times happy times at this spot on Saturday nights" so if you like juke boxes, well they got one. Now if you like pool,don't fret. if you ,Like myself and many other geniuses prefer your drinks strong but done with taste then they not only have it covered but they will even provide you with live entertainment that is very easy on the eyes if you go to the back and follow the steps behind the blue door......... The night to go is Saturday night .why,because for free the dudes downstairs get their international and local DJ bad asses  friends in for a live DJ sets  served while you socialize in a non pretentious setting. look for  good looking crowd no further because they are all there. boys and girls i believe i found my new favorite hang out spot in town. now also when i went down to the DJ lounge underneath the bar i told the bar tender i am a yelper and he let me in on a little secret: if you say yelp 3 times you get $2 fer nett shots all night. so imagine my face when i kept yelping for about two minutes and sure enough i don't really remember how i got home and how this beautiful  i was having breakfast with even got to meet me. but in conclusion don't think it's paradise that's OK  because i do

Zm9A2hOZ9y1VaJgJBSL51A.review_text: Love this place. One of my favorite dive bars in the city. Always come for the 2 for 1 deal and always end up staying longer... and drinking more... than I intended. Everyone is always having a good time.  The pool table is never empty and the jukebox is so popular it's almost impossible to hear your song play unless you request next play! Although sometimes it seems to be nothing but heavy metal music which isn't my favorite, but to each his own! I deal.   I've never used the photo-booth but have always thought it's awesome that they have it. It's definitely a spot a lot of locals hit, but everyone is welcome. There are so many bars close by, it is definitely worth stopping in on your way!

68xw9Oy5J4UuurV5bwJbvA.review_text: last night i went to columbus cafe for the fourth time, and decided that it definitely deserves 5 stars.  i'm probably repeating sentiments found in many of the other reviews (which i did not read), but i couldn't resist the urge to gush about this place.  the music is always excellent (really; i think they have a jukebox thing but there's absolutely no need for it), the bartenders are kind and accommodating, and the place is relatively clean.  a generally attractive clientele also helps, as do the generous happy hour and decent draft selection.  oh, and it's right next door to golden boy pizza, which is transcendental, to say the least.

LlQEmHgFDMGOJrYVJaf3eA.review_text: This bar is great. We stumbled in here one night trying to get away from the bustling, pompus natured bars on Union St. Columbus Cafe reminds me every time why I love North Beach so much. The drinks are stiff, service is fast, friendly, and knowledgable. We always end up meeting new friends here.

dAmglI3_6Z1MS3efeEM4SQ.review_text: We were there on Sun, 10/26/14, for the World Series.  First, the rudest bartenders ever.  You can check my reviews--I'm not a psycho venter.  I'm 44 and write real reviews.  At this bar, they obviously don't like patrons unless you're young, douchey and/or blonde. I honestly believe I was treated rudely b/c I don't fit into those categories.  No food, but you can bring food in.  Good beer options & prices.  If they could JUST get professional staff.  I guess they don't care b/c of the cheap beer prices.  Sigh.

YlnOzp45KWr1-VGN1WIJoA.review_text: $5 beers AND a token for a free draft beer if you come during happy hour and purchase a beer?!? Too good to be true!  We came here to watch the Niners vs Packers playoff game, and this place was packed! However, the bartenders did an incredible job of making sure everyone's glasses were full; I don't think I ever waited more than a minute to order and receive my next drink. The crowd here is very fun, and it never got too overwhelmingly packed. A plus is that if you're a girl, there wasn't a wait for a restroom even though there is just one women's restroom. I know that seems ridiculous, but when you're used to waiting in long lines, and you've broken that seal after one too many beers, it's something you can really appreciate!  This place is also conveniently located next to a lot of good food, so after you have a good buzz on, you can just walk a few steps and be on your way to some delicious drunk food.

tIYV3B9e6JeCfyZiNAJ4QA.review_text: Amazing, awesome dive bar. I lost a Saturday here a few weeks ago. With the low prices and the happy hour special, a  whole evening of drinking cost about $50 for two, and they have some very nice beers on tap. Good jukebox, too. I vaguely remember rocking out to the Clash at some point.

BdcNkjxcse8y48YISk6low.review_text: Columbus Cafe, you're a bad influence on me.  Why do I ALWAYS get into trouble within your neon radius?  Maybe it's because you're always my third stop on the pub crawl trail, maybe.

z1ixmBo0A8IbRwS2WVRUwg.review_text: Ever since I've been going here it's been a consistent good time.  I can't say I vibe with the clientele certain times, but the bartenders are always great, Karlee, Kelly, Danielle, Christian and others all quality staff.  I'm definitely a fan of the three dollar shots of fernet branca(miss it when they were $2, if you can believe)  The shots are usually overflowing to boot.  They have a great selection of taps my faves being the high octane Racer 5 IPA(7%) and the more mellow Guiness(which is usually pricier than other drafts elsewhere).  The only cons are that some people smoke to close to the door and it drifts inside & besides that smell sometimes it smells like disenfectant, hey it's a bar though.    The two for one happy hour is a great deal especially with their selection of drafts.  One pint at $5 between 4-8pm will get you a chip redeemable for another pint before 9pm or keep it and save it for another night.  With good times & deals like these don't be a douche & skimp on the tip.  I tip a dollar a drink, even on the free ones, & the staff definitely appreciate & recognize their better behaved regulars.

IJMSf5JMroRpxpO09zt8Ug.review_text: My dream drinking establishment has a full bar, is fairly empty and has an amazing juke box. This place has all of that and more.   On Saturday, April 18th I stumbled into Columbus Cafe with some friends after a birthday dinner. At midnight I turned the big 2-4. That's when the bartender bought me a shot. Then at 2am as the bar was closing up I realized they didn't get to the song that I played on the jukebox so, being the annoying birthday girl that I was, I asked if they would skip ahead and let us stay to hear it. They agreed and I was grateful. This place was such a great find. In my drunken stupor I forgot to close my tab and collect my debit card so when I realized this, the morning of my actual birthday, we walked on down to Columbus Cafe, kept my tab open from the night before and had a beer. This turned into two, then three, then a shot with the bartender, Christian, who gave us one of the shots for free. After a game of pool, many attempts to beat the high score on exotic photo hunt and a few delicious drinks, we decided to head out on the town and do some sightseeing before heading home. I can thank Columbus Cafe for an amazing birthday. I liked it so much that I got a business card so I can have a private party in their room downstairs on my birthday next year!   Thank you, Columbus Cafe! See you next year!

XrzkP-EPpql8cis-GlQ57A.review_text: Not for me.   Young frat boys and inattentive barkeeps. Twenty-somethings yelling and pushing each other and throwing fake punches. It felt like college all over again--thank god that phase is over..... Great variety of beers on tap though.

_dUFC3yYJLnZf1iF2_oqtQ.review_text: Kona porter: THREE DOLLARS!  You can't beat that.  Bartenders were great.  The place was crowded, but not too crowded.  Got to play first game of pool in over a year.    Only bothersome thing was I was approached twice by some people trying to sell charity stuff.  The first guy was like, donate $10 and then you get some beer for $2.  Hmm, that still means I'm paying $12 for a beer.  I don't even know what charity you are talking about.  Approached later by someone selling raffle tickets.  As it was later, and I had a couple more drinks, I bought one.  Still didn't know what the charity was.  And I never heard the raffle drawing results.    Anywho, good time was had by all.

L3mmNtzxkBBBvB5yAbqL2w.review_text: Two for one!!!  I don't know any places in the Bay Area that have 2 for 1 during happy hour, but this North Beach spot is pretty cool.        They lose two sta\rs because they don't know their heavy metal.  They JDFU.  Gotta fix that.

SgZQwfobmImCDSrO0Vvcmw.review_text: 2 for 1 happy hour that seems to last forever! When my fiancé and I got our tab it was under 30 bucks for 3 hours of heavy drinking. Can't beat that shit! It was exactly what we needed for a night of football and beers.

ctr_BlCf3Ogny-vLs8E9tQ.review_text: I was 86'd from this place.  Apparently so was the bartender who 86'd me.  Does that mean I want to go back in for a cold one sometime?  Absolutely not.  NEXT!!

_xTGGyRuzGUUWujaE4s7hw.review_text: First time here with a group of newly arrived international students. The place was nice, but the female bartender kind of killed the mood when she started yelling at the customers for tips. "Hello people, I don't work for free!". Maybe customer service isn't quite the place for her...

mgAZNT7sMVKy9LY0U1Iihg.review_text: I would like to give this bar a fair review, since I really do enjoy the feeling of neighbourhood bars, especially modest ones, since that is always a plus. The atmosphere in the Columbus Cafe was pretty good, and everyone seemed to be having a good time. The drink prices are reasonable for the area. The only issue with the establishment was the bar staff this past Friday night/Saturday morning.  When I went up to the bar I was promptly attended to by a 20-something barman, and asked what I would like. Assuming the bar was fully stocked I asked for a gin and tonic. I saw him make the drink and noticed that he put a copious amount of gin (always a good thing) and he filled the rest of the glass with what I presumed was tonic. Wrong. He filled it up with sprite, and I could clearly taste it.   I called him back to let him know that I didn't order a gin and sprite, that I wanted one with tonic, instead of saying that the bar did not have any tonic, he snapped back "oh, you want tonic? Well here you go" and he pulled the soda hose out and overflowed my drink with whatever soda button he pressed.  For the rest of the night he chose to ignore me, and didn't attend to me until the lady at the bar (who seemed busy on the other side) insisted he stopped cleaning glasses, and go and help me.  Although I did enjoy the atmosphere, I don't plan on going back to this bar /cafe anytime soon.  Update:  Still don't like this place. Service is still bad.

qwBq50vfZX9xc8oqi-nIhg.review_text: Yesterday my boyfriend and my Italian friend head to North Beach after watching the SF Giro for a beer. We've been here before and we always have fun and heck, the 2 for 1 happy (4) hour(s) is something you can't really pass up. We sat down in the window at the end of the bar where a pleasant young lady asked us what we'd like. We order our beers and relax. We're feeling the "lazy last day of holiday weekend" set in on a beautiful, sunny SF day.   All of a sudden in my haze of sunshine and beer, I see the bartender, Kelley, with the soda gun aimed at someone saying "I will spray you if you don't get out of here right now!". What? ^^ What the heck is going on? I look and there is this old lady (not too old, don't get all crazy! She was like that old leather-worn from smoking and drinking too much type. Not the cute grandma type). The old lady tried to take a swing at Kelley with her bag but she was most likely too drunk to follow through. Kelley starts spraying the lady in the face like one of those carnival games where you spray in the mouth of the clown. A guy comes over and pushes the lady straight out the door and they leave her dripping and wide-eyed on the sidewalk.  WHAT THE F*** JUST HAPPENED???   OMG! THAT JUST HAPPENED??!!!  "She comes in here all the time, she's mean and she always bails on her tabs!", says Kelley.  Now that I have my jaw off the floor I start dying laughing!! This was SERIOUSLY the funniest most random but absolutely HILARIOUS thing that has happened to me in YEARS!   So, here's your break down..   1 star for 2 for 1 beers (26 beers on tap but only 25 of them qualify for 2 for 1!). 1 star for good atmosphere and the ability to being in outside food since they don't serve any 1 star for great location - right next to Golden Boy!! YAY! 1 star for the best bartender EVER 1 star for making me laugh the hardest I have in FOREVER!   I will be back. I will most definitely be back. Every time I go to North Beach. It's my new religion.

wHvO5kK43yjqkcQ4HdtNAQ.review_text: My friends and I accidentally stumbled upon this place when we were trying to cab it from Columbus and Green to Bubble Lounge on Montgomery. Beers were served in huge mugs and only $5! It had a very chill atmosphere with a younger friendlier crowd which I liked.   I'm from San Jose so if I could compare this bar to one in San Jose, I would say it most closely resembles Firehouse in Downtown San Jose, which I am also a huge fan of due to its chill atmosphere and bartenders. I will definitely be back for more than just a quick stop next time!

9jZAXnAaulEC40wtEZK6Fw.review_text: $3.00 Fernet, 2 for 1 specials from 4-8pm Daily. Need I say more.  A woman walks into a bar with her 5 pound Chihuahua and sits down next to this guy, whom she notices is feeling a little bit queasy. A few minutes go by and the guy looks at her and blows his chunks. He looks down and sees the little dog struggling in a pool of vomit and says, "Whoa, I don't remember eating that!"

xLgipMEceGu1iKT5As9iZg.review_text: This is the best bar ever!!!! And not just because Im friends with the awesome Bartender Karlee but because of the $3 dollar fernet and 2 for 1 pints. For someone who loves fernet, beer and Karlee... this is good. Atmosphere is great. Definitely check it out

aS8mvg6EYBQrPp7n36MUOw.review_text: The bleached blonde beezy behind the bar needs to chillllll the fuck out. My friends and I waited, patiently, for the bathroom for a good 15 minutes. When it was our turn, we went in.  Now I get VERY annoyed when dumb bitches take forever in the bathroom. Like seriously, I think most of them are doing blow in the stalls, cuz what could be taking so long? But not my friends and I...we get in, we get out in under 3 minutes for 3 of us to do our business.   After spending our precious 3 minutes in the bathroom this crazy bitch comes barking at us to get out of the bathroom. She kept SCREAMING in our face to get out. We are paying customers, and that is no way to treat people. It's freakin' St. Patrick's Day! Lighten up, have some holiday spirit and calmmmm yourself! And try smiling....it might help, and you might not be so angry at the world.

ubmbxYDfthzthk3RpjkvlA.review_text: 1 star for the one of the RUDEST bartenders I have ever encountered.  It was last Sunday, the glorious day when the italian heritage fest took place. After the parade, we wandered in here. the first bartender we encountered was pleasant and gave my pal some free drink tokens after we were there for a while.   Then SHE came in. She was a short haired thin chick. I was nice and she had an attitude from the beginning. I played over $10 worth of songs on the jukebox and she preceded to fast forward through all of my songs (there were a lot) while making side comments to trolls at the bar that she was flirting with. So impressive. When I finally said something she said I could ask for my money back and continued to skip through my songs. You could have that $10, girl. You need it way more than I do. YOU'RE WELCOME.  My group was literally there for 5+ hours buying tons of drinks, making friends, and being merry. I don't like to base my reviews on one bad apple, but come on, you're a bar, so bartenders are pretty important. 100s of dollars later with stink face fast forwarding through all of my songs my buzz was totally killed. Needless to say, I will not be returning. YOU'RE WELCOME.

J5MJGJr939qH0XfBqEC81A.review_text: Whenever I'm in North Beach, I wind up here at the end of my evening. This is the kind of place where you can get a good drink, play some pool and rock out to the juke box. Depending on the 'tender, the drinks are usually strong, the crowd is always interesting and they rock $2 Fernet shots.   This is definitely a dive where I don't care what I am wearing and I'm dancing like no one's watching! Love it!

oQBbnY3W8FYYQpU0UGqjRQ.review_text: 2 for 1 drafts until 8 and golden boy pizza a few stores up for your drunken munchies.  Enough said.

4InFkxzE3nxy5hd5IfLSFw.review_text: This place is pretty crackin' on Friday nights. Filled with young peeps.  There is also a downstairs area too with couches and stuff...I'd have to say that the location of the bathroom (there are 2, one for girls, one for boys) is the shittiest planning ever created because it's right by the entrance to the stairwell downstairs, so if you're waiting to pee, you need to be careful of traffic and getting hit by the swinging doors from people coming to and from the stairs.  There is a pool table too, so you can play some pool, or drink your face off, whatever floats your boat.

adVI87W7gLjHM4fw58Ce_g.review_text: I'm going to have to second Andrew "Dice" K on this one...   Where else can you get 2 x1 draft beers during happy time in the city? Shhh... I hear its illegal. They hand you a pint glass and a poker chip, and you can either have el segundo on the house, or you can bring it back another day when you need to wet your whistle. Czechvar on tap. Solidne.   If you go, say "Hi!" to Lopair and Christian (bartenders).

vE9wz9IgvRfMMpNtLbg68A.review_text: North Beach "attitude bar" with too much attitude.   Once upon a time there was a bar that catered to locals, and pushed an attitude to be different than the rest. it was a locals bar and a treasured spot. The service was good, and the attitude was a theme more than a requirement.  Now, after many years, the "attitude" has caught up with itself and attracted folks from all around. The service has been poor, and the attitude is part of the atmosphere.   I've gone to CC for almost 6 years, now, i can say that after a few bad experiences with the day manager, and some of the "new staff", i can say that the once great treasure has become fools gold.  Go to Columbus Cafe if you want to mystically teleport yourself into the mission and hang out with Hipsters and other people who are "too cool for you." If you are in north beach, try Rogue, Kennedy's, or the Saloon and skip the Columbus Cafe.

p6qMidPaJ96LgB_9z7xZVw.review_text: I think this may be the best happy hour I've found in San Francisco so far.  2-for-1 specials every afternoon! And if you don't spend your free drink token, then you can keep it and use it whenever you next make it back to their happy hour. Fantastic. A bit of a walk from the Financial District after work, but I would be willing to make the trek because of the deal. Bartender was also pretty friendly when I was here, checking in with us often enough to feel like we were being taken care of, but not so often as to feel as though he were pushing us to hurry up and get our next drink.

uFQHvEPRDwiU2s1zbSLghw.review_text: If a Boston re-plant feels comfortable in a place, that says something. this place is "legit"! It also helps to have a good pizza place nearby...burp! I love it!

T1kRNW8UyZkcs1K1O0Gb_A.review_text: Total neighborhood bar. Popped in last night for a drink and it was really fun. I wish the gents would have been more outgoing, but this is another story. We sat in the window, had a few cocktails and had a blast. It gets a bit crowded after happy hr, so word to the wise. BTW they have this super cool system that is for beer. 2x1. They give you a poker chip w/ your beer and you turn it back in for 2nd one. Love the system:)

0u5JfFEbkHwqWUOQtewU8Q.review_text: Considering how many great bars are in North Beach, i'm surprised this place is still in business. The drinks are mediocre, it smells like a barn and they consistently have the rudest bartenders I've ever met.   Do yourself a favor and go to one of the 20 awesome bars in this neighborhood instead.

jEyb7v42sgIZZhwxnynFfg.review_text: This is THE best frikin' dive bar in North Beach - it does get CRAZY here when they have specials but being within walking distance when I lived in 94133, I could drop in often.  I actually used to see people light up a smoke INSIDE the bar and no one even blinked. Don't know if they allow that anymore but imo it added sort of a cool factor to the place being SF is so pissy about smoking unless it's pot.

9u8d_na5feZSZYok-Wb-BQ.review_text: Good prices, good selection, friendly bartenders, and a great music selection.  Pool table, drunk people.  New Jersey salutes you.

jqJMZO-kXWdZ-oghWGZ35w.review_text: A nice dark bar.  Went here for an office happy hour and had a great time.  the 2 for 1 beers are definitely the way to go and they have a respectable variety of scotch.  Would definitely come back

vQ5_AFIOkvY6jiL8FNPsAw.review_text: Highlights: 2 for 1 happy hour Pool table  Photo booth Jukebox TVs  Columbus Cafe is that cool divey bar you grab a chill drink at durning the week and can come again Saturday night to get a little crazy with friends.  There's a great mix of oddball locals and randoms from other neighborhoods seeking the easygoing vibe. It's a mainly mid-20s crowd, but not obnoxious. It can get pretty crowded during the weekend and for sports games so make sure you come early if you want a seat.  Pro tips:  Make sure to tip the wonderful gentleman behind the bar when using those poker chips!  They can skip jukebox songs so don't choose something overplayed.  Pool sharks abound! If they look like they know their game, then back off for a hot minute.

v1MgXY1gKx1qwcIZ2QGAoQ.review_text: This bar gets high points for what will likely seem entirely inconsequential to anyone but me, but which absolutely made my night: Stevie Wonder songs playing all night long!  At first I was just thrilled that I heard one song come on. Then I was astonished to hear # 2, 3...4, 5!, 6 hotdamn!, 7!!!, 8....:D  Yes, other music came on as well which was enjoyable but the Stevie Wonder marathon is like the epitome of good music for a party night in my (admittedly dorky) opinion. And when I asked the bartender why all the Stevie Wonder---because she and the staff like it! Good people!  The bar was actually pretty empty when we came in and we had access to the pool table and enjoyed a round. Just a chill, sorta divey but fun place!

3k3hFdi0DqlGMSJ4Fmxknw.review_text: Columbus Cafe is my new favorite place to drink beers in North Beach. Clean "dive" bar, good jukebox, friendly bartenders and 2 of my favorite beers on tap - Franziskaner and Hoegaarden! Plus 2 for 1 beers during happy hour!

63SQPROZ48xwGUb2LloFQA.review_text: A pretty good thing to do is walk down to this block of Green St. with about 20 or 30 bucks in your pocket. Duck into the Columbus Cafe before happy hour (I think the bartender said 4-8) and order a draft beer. He'll then give you a poker chip redeemable for a second beer until 9pm.   Repeat this process several times and then go up the street for a couple of slices of Golden Boy.  If that doesn't make you happy I'm not sure what will.

o5W5bvXZMZ_oqeMq7IZ6Ng.review_text: Super cool little place.  Owners are nice people who helped out my friends with their breast cancer walk.  Bartenders are solid and nice looking.  Got to love drink deals and a pool table.

2AW-NegGX-SOjtk6UqVXjw.review_text: If I was to rate this bar for the first hour and a half I was there, it would have been a definite 5 stars. Great beers 2 for 1. The first bartender we had was very personable and nice, sorry I don't remember her name but she was blond.   The 2 stars comes from the second bartender who started at 7pm, brown haired. Watch out! She was extremely rude, I'm not sure if she was having a bad night but literally the worst service I have ever experienced. We left before we used our free chips because we couldn't stand her. Beware

O3Ro7mtNn86NRlCMaZ3F0A.review_text: Been going here for 10 years and have nothing but great things to say about the bartenders and the place. Great pool and great drinks. Music is great and the bathroom is always clean. No place to dance but people do anyway. It will always be my little local.

PadmV2GEoA6mWpQUpPh7Ig.review_text: I totally dig the vibe of this place...  No pretensions..just a bunch of cool artistic looking people with a mix of people who don't give a f*ck about other people but themselves (in a good way) and people who are truly wasted dancing and singing to the sound from their modern jukebox... No need to wear those sky high heels... and short vaginal dresses...no need to put on heavy makeup and fake lashes... no need to do your hair and look like a barbie doll...  It's so cool; all you need is yourself and your dranks and a few cool friends and you'll have fun...  $15.00 over only for Credit cards....  Recently priced shots.... Cool bartender... nice place to hang and even with the music..it's pretty bearable to sit on one of their tables and have a conversation with your friends over draaaaaaanks....

Bjxnb734DA3PxFyif6f0hA.review_text: One of the top 5 happy hour spots in the city! 2 for 1 is obviously beyond fair. The bartenders are always cool, the crowd is chill. I don't know how many times I have gone here, but I know how many times I have left sober. Notaone!   Do me a favor- go to this bar for happy hour, take advantage of all the delicious beers they have on tap, 2 for 1 of coarse, strike up a conversation with some of the regulars and the bartender, and if you still don't have a good time. Go home and watch The Real House Wives of Orange County with your 9 cats and Costco size Bon Bons, cause you don't deserve to take up space in a bar anyway.  They lost one star because parking is nearly impossible. Take a cab, your gonna need it when you leave anyway.

olMvJFXQMMU-trU9D3F05w.review_text: 2 for 1 beers every night. Nuff said.  Gotta love the fact that the backpack I carry to work every day now has a pocket full of chips just in case we stop at the Cafe after leaving the office (which we do way too often)

GiBM39Ljmkk7u3kWarUpFA.review_text: I went here with a few friends and we shot some pool and drink some beer, happy hours is a fun time the bartender knows how to make a well drink and a excellent pour on shots. Fun Bar.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: The best place to watch the Giants.  I love the fellow fans here.

w4z9qW0B-camy3OtEHaxog.review_text: One star for the 2 for 1 beer happy hour and another for Wii bowling.   I've given this place a try a couple of times and there's a meathead vibe that I can't quite put my finger on here. The two highlights were getting drunk really quick and on the cheap and kicking ass on the Wii.  And there's just something wrong about a digital jukebox. Too many options for really bad music.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: *update 1/28/2008* I returned to Columbus Cafe a year and a half after my initial review...this time around, service was fantastic (it probably didn't hurt that Yelper Karlee D. was behind the bar) so I'm bumping them up to four stars.  My one complaint is that the music at happy hour was LOUD.  Love the jukebox selection but why turn it to 11 so early in the evening?  *original review* Good happy hour (2 for 1 beers) and a great jukebox should earn the Columbus Cafe at least 4 stars but the bartender was kind of a jerk hence the 3 stars.

fxJcpYyCBgi61PtmlZXTjQ.review_text: I think this might be my favorite bar in North Beach. The 2-for-1 happy hour draft special is fantastic - 7 days a week they give you a token you can redeem for another beer until 9pm. They have a nice selection of draft beers that makes this a genuinely good deal, a well-stocked full bar and skilled, efficient bartenders to back that up. There's also a pool table and Wii sports (when a game's not on).  Happy hour is from 4-8pm: All tap beers are 2 for the price of 1 (except Chimay)! Every beer you buy you get a chip for one free draft beer. Chips good until 9pm.

WnzRueYdRWNSbkXB0_0i4Q.review_text: Come here for happy hour $5 or 2 for one beers. Staff isn't as friendly as other places, but drinks are good and they have TV's to watch sports. A decent dive bar in North Beach.

SH6Vg0t4-dKnG0rzeNjMTg.review_text: Columbus Cafe knows that it is and knows what it is not. It is a divy, old school, north beach bar, popular for strong drinks. It is not a classy back lit over priced bar like it's neighbor, Amante. I'm not sure how the other reviews failed to mention Kenny the bartender. Thursday through Saturday the small bottom portion of the bar is open and Kenny the bartender serves strong  - but not stronger than whatever he's drinking - red bull and vodkas in pint glasses. Make sure to get to know Kenny while you're there (he'll probably give you a free drink), then hang out in one of the old torn up office chairs and watch people play pool and smoke. You'll always meet some interesting, and very drunk, people down there.

fbiJKax4YBWUBw6Jz4psCA.review_text: If you are looking to host an awesome party for ~50-100 people, Columbus Cafe is your spot! We had our annual holiday party here after multiple years of angry landlords/police/neighbors, and it did not disappoint. They let us wrap the whole basement in holiday wrapping paper, choose our own special holiday drinks, and control the music the whole night. The basement will definitely bring you back to your college days (in a good way) if you spent a lot of time at fraternities.  The staff (mainly Evan) were incredibly accommodating and even let us take over upstairs once it become clear we had too many people for downstairs. To host an incredible party with our own drinks, decoration, and music for only $100 cleaning was an absolute steal. Thanks for making our annual holiday party an absolute blast CC, see you next year!

Ad9CVmXNegnsfYZWBYKoxw.review_text: One of the best happy hr bar in San Francisco. Two for one happy hr is freaking awesome.You can save your tokens and return another time to cash them out if you don't feel like getting wasted. Beer selection is good and prices are fair. Every time I come here I'm never can save any of my tokens :) and pay the price the next day.

rDTr5r0xEMpQpkPphe66KQ.review_text: Where do you put a dumpster that is too dirty?    Another dumpster?  I guess you'd need a real big one.  Try Columbus Cafe;  a special kind of dumpster for trashy trash.

Hl1f4VO0a9KdGrrRCPMqSA.review_text: This bar can get a little overrun with drunk idiots. The employees are cool, the scene varies.

YSVavZvOLsknCoQnMG8_HQ.review_text: Buy one beer get one beer free happy hour is all good. Chill watering hole. Got great beers on tap. We had amstel lights, tecate, apricot ale and the list goes on. They had like 20 beers on draft easy. Cool bartenders and good drink specials. Only been here once but i was glad to have a beer hear. Great neighborhood next to great restaurants.

LahgT0Dec0B6NSws7VHiJQ.review_text: I'm a bit of a masochist, and that's why I drink Fernet.  It takes a certain type of person to drink this stuff, and I happen to be one of them. Really, it's a love-it or hate-it type of shot, and actually meant to be sipped after a big dinner so that one can calm their stomach after gorging themselves with (insert food here).  Columbus Cafe doesn't have food (although Golden Boy Pizza is a few doors down and you can bring it inside Columbus Cafe if you like), and they believe the best way to drink Fernet is in the form of a shot & in large quantities--that's why it costs a mere $3.  I've been here twice now & both times things started to get sorta fuzzy as the night progressed. I may/may not have eaten too much pizza, and I may/may not have flown home on a magical Fernet unicorn...  The bartenders here are great, provided you don't act like the typical weekend clientele that visits North Beach.  Columbus Cafe, Do you have my new beanie? I may have left it there, or perhaps the magical Fernet unicorn needed it to keep its unihorn warm & dry instead.

dE9YaRaUtkDm-xJrW3BSPg.review_text: again, a pretty typical small sf dive bar.  a couple screens to watch sports.  bartenders were quite inattentive.  2 for 1 beer special is hard to beat.

xt8tqNaVPzgBhhftXBr-5A.review_text: A true dive bar with "buy one, get one free" everyday from 4 p.m. to 8 p.m.  If you're in North Beach and want to escape the tourists, this is a great spot.  Caution:  You go here to get wasted and have conversations with crazy North Beach men who talk about "the old days" and stare at you when you talk to your other friends.  Once you are nice and wasted, go to Golden Boy and get a slice, it's two doors over.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: Heyyy!! What's not to love??  I got to know Columbus Cafe when I was working in the area. Trust me, people who work with the 18 and under after school are probably the most alcoholic WHILE BROKE in the world.  Why should you come here? TWO FOR ONE BEER. That's right, TWO FOR ONE. You buy one, they give you a chip. Chip is good until 9! Now, make note. The chips are given until 8PM, but are good until 9PM. Any night. Say you drank a few too many but have a chip left over. What to do?? Well...clearly, come back another day for another drink!  Another plus: You can bring in food. Golden Boy less than half a block away?? Winning. You can venture out every 10 minutes to check if the clam garlic pizza is free while sipping 2-for-1 beers!   I've been here on those strange nights where there's dancing downstairs. Not bad...not what I expected, but its all good.   Only two awkward moments here, which I clearly must share:  1) For a while (about a year ago) one of the bartenders was heavily pregnant. Wow...good thing no mixed drinks, otherwise fetal alcohol!  2) A random guy leaning over to my friend and I ordering Hoegaarden and correcting our pronunciation. "I don't mean to sound pretentious, but its pronounced 'who-garden' " WHO the fuck are you and WHY do I care? I've tried ordering a "who-garden" and no one knows wtf it is. Fail guy, fail.  ***I've been corrected. It was 2.5 years ago the bartender was pregnant. And for the record, there's nothing wrong with it. It was just a surprising thing to view at a bar (for me).

aei-4QBYVdUAcQOyu9jSGQ.review_text: Probably falls into the category of Dive Bar for most, but I like this place.  The bartender on Tuesday nights is nice and puts up with my (and my friends') annoying qualities.  Read: drunken stupidity.  One pool table in the back malfunctions and kicking it does no good.  Asking the bartender to fix it works much better.  Ask for a shot of Fernet's - most of you will regret it.

wb2I6PxYjRStE7OGLL4S7A.review_text: Photo Booth + Strong cocktails = Endless hours of fun and embarrassing photos  p.s. $3.00 Fernet, 2 for 1 specials from 4-8pm EVERY DAY

w7CvXX2dtmPCm67TRJw7kQ.review_text: What a fantastic respite in the midst of some serious douchiness. I love the beers they have on tap, the drink specials, the dankness of the environment (hey, what can I say, I love a good dive), and the fact that they give you chips to carry around making you want to come back and get a 2 for 1 beer during the week.  It's easy to like the bartendresses too. They are hot and give good customer service. Even to the douches who come in thinking it's a douchey bar.  I promise my next review will be sans douche.
